src: 确保你的手尽可能地放松，同时仍可以正确地敲击所有的音符—手指也尽量不要做太多无关的动作。 这样就能让你尽可能节省体力。记住，不用像在钢琴上那样用力敲击琴键来提升音量。 为了提高手风琴的音量，可以更用力或以更快的速度拉风箱。
mt: 1. Make sure your hands are as relaxed as possible while still being able to hit all the notes correctly—try not to make too many unnecessary movements with your fingers. This will help you conserve as much energy as possible. Remember, you don't have to hit the keys as hard as you would on a piano to increase the volume. To increase the volume of the harmonium, you can either hit the keys harder or faster or pull the bellows faster.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: 确保你的手尽可能地放松，同时仍可以正确地敲击所有的音符—手指也尽量不要做太多无关的动作。 这样就能让你尽可能节省体力。记住，不用像在钢琴上那样用力敲击琴键来提升音量。 为了提高手风琴的音量，可以更用力或以更快的速度拉风箱。
mt: 1. Make sure your hands are as relaxed as possible while still being able to hit all the notes correctly—try not to make too many unnecessary movements with your fingers. This will help you conserve as much energy as possible. Remember, you don't have to hit the keys as hard as you would on a piano to increase the volume. To increase the volume of the harmonium, you can either hit the keys harder or faster or pull the bellows faster.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: 在尝试将电影转换成 DVD 格式时，最常见的问题之一是过度扫描。 大多数电视节目都是为娱乐大众而制作的。 出于该原因，你在电视上看到的画面边框，包括顶部、底部和侧边，都被裁剪了。 这样做是为了保证图像能覆盖住整个屏幕。这叫做“过度扫描”。 遗憾的是，当你制作 DVD 时，它的边框很可能也会被裁剪掉，而且如果视频中的字幕太靠近底部，那么字幕也会显示不完整。
mt: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is overscan. Most television programs are made for the general public. For this reason, the borders of the picture, including the top, bottom, and sides, are cropped on television. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, the borders may also be cropped, and if the subtitles are too close to the bottom, the subtitles may be incomplete.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: 美国计划从三个不同的方向发动协同攻击。 约翰·卡德瓦德将军将向波登镇的英国守军发动一场进攻，转移敌方注意力，以阻挡任何增援部队。 詹姆斯·尤因将军率 700 名民兵在特伦顿渡口渡河，占领了阿森皮克湾上的桥梁，阻断了敌军逃跑的路径。 2400 人的主力部队将在特伦顿 (Trenton) 以北 9 英里处渡河，然后分成两组，一组由格林 (Greene) 指挥，一组由沙利文 (Sullivan) 指挥，以便在黎明前发动进攻。
mt: 3 separate attacks are planned. John Cadwalader will attack the British garrison at Bordentown, drawing off reinforcements to prevent any relief. James Ewing will lead 700 militia across the Delaware at Trenton Ferry, capturing the bridge over Assunpink Creek, blocking the enemy's escape route. The main force of 2400 will cross the river 9 miles north of Trenton, and divide into two groups, one led by Greene, the other by Sullivan, to attack at dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: 由议长约翰·汉考克和秘书长查尔斯·汤姆逊签署的手写草案在7月4日得到大陆议会批准，之后被送到几个街区以外的约翰·邓拉普印刷厂付印。 一夜之间印刷了 150 到 200 份，就是现在众所周知的“邓拉普宽边”(Dunlap broadsides) 版。 7 月 8 日，约翰·尼克松 (John Nixon) 在独立大厅的院子里首次公开宣读了这份文件。 其中一封于 7 月 6 日寄给了乔治·华盛顿，华盛顿于 7 月 9 日在纽约向他的军队宣读了这封信。一份副本于 8 月 10 日抵达伦敦。 尚存的 25 份当列普单面印刷版（ Dunlap broadsides）是该文件现存最早的版本。手写原稿未能保留下来。
mt: The handwritten draft was approved by the Continental Congress on July 4, 1776, and sent to the John Dunlap printing house in John Dunlap's neighborhood. 150 to 200 copies were printed overnight, known as the "Dunlap broadsides."  On July 8, John Nixon read the document in the Independence Hall courtyard.  A copy was sent to George Washington, who read it to his army on July 9 in New York.  A copy arrived in London on August 10.  The 25 surviving single-sided Dunlap broadsides are the earliest known versions of the document.  The handwritten original was not preserved.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: 看到这种活动，殖民者也要求了增援。 支援前沿阵地的部队包括 200 人的新罕布什尔第 1 团和第 3 团，由约翰·斯塔克上校和詹姆斯·里德上校（后来都成为了将军）指挥。 斯塔克(Stark) 的士兵沿着殖民者阵地北端的防御围栏站位。 退潮时，沿半岛东北部流淌的神秘河打开了一道缺口，他们迅速建起一堵短石墙，把围墙延伸到岸边北端的小海滩上。 格里德利（Gridley）或斯塔克（Stark ）在栅栏前 100 英尺（ 30 米）处放置一根木桩，并命令在正规军经过前不许开火。
mt: Seeing this, the colonists also requested reinforcements. The troops sent to support the front line included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire Regiments, each of 200 men, commanded by Colonel John Stark and Colonel James Reed, both of whom would later become generals. Stark's men took position along the defensive palisade at the northern end of the colonist line. At low tide, a mysterious river flowing along the northeastern shore of the peninsula opened a gap, and they quickly built a short stone wall extending the palisade to the northern end of the small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a wooden stake 100 feet (30 m) in front of the palisade and ordered that no regulars were to fire until the regulars had passed through.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: 中国古代的不同时期各有特点；中国的每个时期或每个执掌天下的家族都是一个特点鲜明的王朝。 同样，历朝历代更迭期间都是一段小国分立的不稳定时代。其中最有名的便是长达 60 年的三国时期，该时期处于汉晋两代的更迭之间。 在这些动乱时期，各路诸侯为争夺王位而发生激烈战争。 三国是中国古代历史上最血腥的时代之一。成千上万的人为了争夺西安豪华宫殿最高的权力而死去。
mt: Each of China's different periods has its own characteristics; each dynasty or ruling family is a distinct and prominent empire. Similarly, the periods of dynastic change are also a period of instability when small countries are divided. The most famous of these is the 60-year Three Kingdoms period, which is between the Han and Jin dynasties. In these turbulent times, the various lords fought fiercely for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the most bloody periods in ancient Chinese history. Thousands of people died for the highest power of the luxurious palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: 行军蚁群的行进和筑巢也分不同的阶段。 在迁徙阶段，行军蚁在夜间出行，白天停下来安营。 当可利用的食物减少时，这个蚁群就会迎来迁徙期。在这一阶段，蚁群会建造每天更换的临时巢穴。 这种游牧性的横冲直撞行为每次都会持续 17 天左右。
mt: Ant colonies have different stages of marching and building. During the migration stage, the ants march at night and stop during the day. When the food is reduced, the colony will enter the migration period. At this stage, the ants will build temporary nests every day. This nomadic behavior will last about 17 days each time.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: 研究者观察到的许多生理节律和行为节律很大程度上往往取决于通过生物钟而产生的内生周期及其存在。 周期性的节奏不仅仅是对外部周期信号的简单反应。这种节奏在包括细菌、真菌、植物和动物等大多数生物中都有记录。 生物钟是能够自我维持的摆动装置，即使在没有外界提示的情况下，也会持续一段时间自由运转的周期。
mt: Many physiological rhythms and behavioral rhythms are largely dependent on the endogenous circadian cycle and its existence. The rhythmicity is not just a simple reaction to external periodic signals. Such rhythms have been recorded in most organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. The biological clock is a self-sustaining oscillatory device that will continue to run freely for a period of time without external cues.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: 种群是指在特定地理区域内特定种类生物体的集合。 当种群中的所有个体在某一特定表型性状上完全相同时，就称之为单型。 当个体表现出某一性状的几个变体时，它们就是多态的。
mt: A population is a collection of individuals of the same species living in a particular geographic area. When all individuals in a population are completely uniform in a particular phenotypic trait, it is called a monomorphic population. When individuals exhibit a few variants of a trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: 种群是指在特定地理区域内特定种类生物体的集合。 当种群中的所有个体在某一特定表型性状上完全相同时，就称之为单型。 当个体表现出某一性状的几个变体时，它们就是多态的。
mt: A population is a collection of individuals of the same species living in a particular geographic area. When all individuals in a population are completely uniform in a particular phenotypic trait, it is called a monomorphic population. When individuals exhibit a few variants of a trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: 自然风光旅游业吸引了那些对自然地区感兴趣的游客，他们前来观赏包括野生动植物在内的自然风景。 现场活动包括打猎、钓鱼、摄影、观鸟、参观公园和研究生态系统。 例如，在婆罗洲参观、拍摄和了解红毛猩猩。
mt: Nature tourism attracts visitors interested in natural areas, who come to see and enjoy natural landscapes including wildlife. Activities on site include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, visiting parks and studying ecosystems. For example, visiting, photographing and learning about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: 每天早上，人们驾车离开小乡镇上班，路上和他们擦肩而过的人的工作地点正是他们离开的地方。 在这种动态交通穿梭中，每个人都以某种方式与基于私家车的交通系统相连接，并对其提供支持。 如今，科学表明，这种大规模的碳经济，再也无法让过去 200 万年来支持人类进化发展的生物圈保持稳定状态。
mt: Every morning, people drive to work from small towns, passing people on their way to work at the same place they are leaving. In this dynamic traffic weaving, everyone is in some way connected to and supporting a car-based transportation system. Today, science shows that this massive carbon economy can no longer support the stable state of the biosphere that has supported human evolution and development for the past 200 million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: 原子可被视为是全部物质的基本组成模块之一。 根据简化的波尔模型显示，这是一个非常复杂的实体，包含了一个由电子环绕的中心原子核，这些电子有点像绕着太阳运行的行星。详见图 1.1。 原子核由中子和质子这两种粒子组成。 质子带有正电，中子不带电。电子带有负电。
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: 当今，几乎所有投入使用的计算机都是以处理二进制编码的信息为基础的。 二进制数只能占两个值里的其中一个，即0或者1，而这样的数被称为二进制数字，即计算机术语中的“位”。
mt: Today, almost all computers in use are based on processing information in binary code. Binary numbers can only take one of two values, either 0 or 1, and are called binary digits, or "bits" in computer terminology.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: 当今，几乎所有投入使用的计算机都是以处理二进制编码的信息为基础的。 二进制数只能占两个值里的其中一个，即0或者1，而这样的数被称为二进制数字，即计算机术语中的“位”。
mt: Today, almost all computers in use are based on processing information in binary code. Binary numbers can only take one of two values, either 0 or 1, and are called binary digits, or "bits" in computer terminology.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "博客还能帮助学生提高写作能力。尽管学生们开始写博客时，用的语法和拼写往往都很马虎，读者的出现通常会改变这一状况。 学生往往是最挑剔的读者，所以博客作者开始努力提高写作水平，避免受到批判。 此外，写博客也“迫使学生对周遭世界更具洞察力“。为满足观众兴趣，学生们受此鼓舞，变得聪明和有趣起来。 写博客是一种能够激发合作的工具，还能鼓励学生把学习延伸到传统的学校授课之外。 ""适当使用博客，""可以使学生变得更善于分析和进行思辨；通过积极回应网络材料，学生们可以在他人文章的上下文语境中找到自己的立场，并能够针对特定问题提出自己的观点（Oravec, 2002）。"""
mt: "Blogs can also help students improve their writing skills. Although students' grammar and spelling are often quite sloppy when they first start blogging, the presence of readers usually changes this. Students are often the most critical readers, so bloggers start to work hard to improve their writing to avoid criticism. In addition, blogging "forces students to be more observant of the world around them." To satisfy their audience, students are inspired to become smart and interesting. Blogging is a tool that can encourage collaboration and also encourages students to extend their learning beyond traditional school instruction. "Appropriate use of blogs," can make students better at analysis and reasoning; by actively responding to network materials, students can find their position in the context of others' articles and can present their own opinions on specific issues (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: 异步通讯让人们有时间思考他人的反应并作出反应。 这让学生能够按自己的节奏学习，并控制传授教学信息的节奏。 此外，由于可以实行弹性工作时间，时间上的限制也比较少。（布雷默，1998年） 学习者可以使用互联网和万维网随时获取信息。 学生也可以在一天中的任何时间把问题提交给老师，并且可以预期得到合理时间内的快速回复，而不用一直等到下一次面谈。
mt: Asynchronous communication allows people time to think about the reactions of others and respond accordingly. This allows students to learn at their own pace and control the pace of teaching information. In addition, because of the flexibility of working hours, the time limit is also less. (Bloomer, 1998) Learners can access information at any time through the Internet and the World Wide Web. Students can also submit questions to the teacher at any time of the day and can expect a quick response within a reasonable time, without having to wait until the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: 这座传统的中世纪城堡长久以来一直激发着人们的想象力，让人联想到马背长矛比武、宴会和亚瑟王骑士精神的画面。 人们即使站在千年的废墟中，也很容易回想起早已逝去的战争的声音和气味，几乎能听到鹅卵石上马蹄的碰撞声，也能闻到从地牢坑里冒出来的恐惧气息。 但是我们的想象有现实依据吗？最初为什么要建城堡？它们是如何设计和建造的？
mt: This traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousting on horseback, feasts and the spirit of the Knights of the Round Table. Even standing in the ruins of a thousand years, it is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of long-dead wars, almost hearing the clatter of hooves on pebbles and the stench of fear from the dungeon pit. But do our imaginations have a basis in reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: 作为那段时期的典型建筑，与其说克尔比墨斯鲁（Muxloe）城堡是一座真正的城堡，不如说它是一座加固的房屋。 它的大玻璃窗和薄墙不可能长时间抵抗得住一次坚决的攻击。 15 世纪 80 年代，在黑斯廷斯勋爵（Lord Hastings）开始建造这座城堡的时候，这个国家还相对和平，只需要防御一小群四处游荡的抢掠者。
mt: As a typical building of that period, it is more appropriate to call Muxloe Castle a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glass windows and thin walls would not have stood up to a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began building this castle, the country was relatively peaceful and only needed to defend against a few roving raiders.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: 从四分之一英里转变为半英里的赛跑，速度变得不那么重要了，耐力成为绝对重要的因素。 当然，要成为一流的半英里跑步选手（在两分钟内跑完），就必须要有足够快的速度，并且要不惜一切代价地培养耐力。 在冬季练练越野跑，加上对上半身的健身锻炼，能为跑步季做好充分准备。
mt: 1/4 mile to 1/2 mile races, speed is not as important, endurance becomes an absolute factor. Of course, to be a top half mile runner (in two minutes), you need to have enough speed and be willing to sacrifice everything to develop endurance. In the winter, practice cross country running, and add upper body workouts, to prepare for the track season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: 仅靠适当的营养实践并不足以造就出色表现，但这可以显著影响年轻运动员的整体健康状况。 保持健康的能量平衡，坚持有效补充水分的习惯，了解合理使用营养补品的各个方面，能够帮助运动员们改善表现，增加运动乐趣。
mt: While proper nutrition alone does not guarantee stellar performance, it can significantly impact the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, adhering to the habit of proper hydration, and understanding the various aspects of appropriate supplementation can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: 中长跑是一项花费相对低廉的运动；然而参与者对所需的几件装备却有很多误解。 可以根据需要购买产品，但大多数产品对成绩几乎没有实际影响。 运动员可能会认为他们倾向于一个产品，尽管这个产品毫无益处。
mt: Long-distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport, but participants have many misconceptions about the equipment needed. Products can be purchased as needed, but most products have little practical effect on performance. Athletes may think they prefer one product, even though it is useless.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: 磁共振成像依据的是一种叫核磁共振 (NMR) 的物理现象，它是费利克斯·布洛赫（在斯坦福大学工作）和爱德华·珀塞耳（来自哈佛大学）于 20 世纪 30 年代发现的。 在这种共振中，磁场和无线电波导致原子发出微弱的无线电信号。 1970 年，医学博士兼研究科学家雷蒙德·达马迪安 (Raymond Damadian) 发现了使用磁共振成像作为医学诊断工具的基础原理。 四年后，一项专利获批准，这是世界上首个颁发的核磁共振领域专利。 1977 年，达马迪安（Damadian）博士完成了第一台 “全身” 核磁共振扫描仪的制造，他称之为 “不屈号”。
mt: Magnetic resonance imaging is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered by Felix Bloch (at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University) in the 1930s. In this resonance, magnetic fields and radio waves cause atoms to emit weak radio signals. In 1970, Dr. Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basic principles of using magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, a patent was approved, which was the first patent issued in the field of nuclear magnetic resonance. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the manufacture of the first "whole body" nuclear magnetic resonance scanner, which he called "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: 到目前为止，人类是最善于读懂他人心思的物种。 这意味着我们能够成功地预测其他人的感知、意图、信仰、知识或欲望。 在这些能力中，理解他人意图至关重要。我们可以凭借这一能力理解身体行为可能表达出的模棱两可的问题。 例如，如果你看到有人打破车窗，你很有可能会认为这个人在偷陌生人的汽车。 如果他是丢了车钥匙，试图打开自己汽车的车门的话，那可能就要另当别论了。
mt: Humans are the most adept at reading others' minds. This means we can successfully predict others' perceptions, intentions, beliefs, knowledge, or desires. Of these abilities, understanding others' intentions is crucial. We can use this ability to understand ambiguous problems that body language may express. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you may think this person is stealing a stranger's car. If he is trying to open his own car door, having lost his keys, that's a different story.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: 到目前为止，人类是最善于读懂他人心思的物种。 这意味着我们能够成功地预测其他人的感知、意图、信仰、知识或欲望。 在这些能力中，理解他人意图至关重要。我们可以凭借这一能力理解身体行为可能表达出的模棱两可的问题。 例如，如果你看到有人打破车窗，你很有可能会认为这个人在偷陌生人的汽车。 如果他是丢了车钥匙，试图打开自己汽车的车门的话，那可能就要另当别论了。
mt: Humans are the most adept at reading others' minds. This means we can successfully predict others' perceptions, intentions, beliefs, knowledge, or desires. Of these abilities, understanding others' intentions is crucial. We can use this ability to understand ambiguous problems that body language may express. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you may think this person is stealing a stranger's car. If he is trying to open his own car door, having lost his keys, that's a different story.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: 人工智能有很强的科幻色彩，但它其实是计算机科学非常重要的一个分支，研究的是机器的行为、学习和智能适应。 人工智能 (AI) 的研究涉及制造机器让需要智能行为的任务自动化。 例子包括控制、规划和调度，回应客户诊断及客户问题的能力，还有手写识别，声音和脸部功能。 所有的这些都成为了独立的学科，着重为现实生活中的问题提供解决方案。 人工智能系统现在经常用于经济、医学、工程学和军事领域，有些家用计算机和电子游戏软件应用程序已经有内置的人工智能系统。
mt: Artificial intelligence has a strong science fiction flavor, but it is actually a very important branch of computer science that studies the behavior, learning and adaptive intelligence of machines. Artificial intelligence (AI) research involves making machines that can automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to respond to customer inquiries and diagnose customer problems, handwriting recognition, voice and facial features. All of these have become independent disciplines, focusing on providing solutions to real-life problems. Artificial intelligence systems are now commonly used in economics, medicine, engineering and the military, and some home computers and video game software applications have built-in artificial intelligence systems.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: 收敛思维模式是通过结合不同的想法或领域来寻找解决方案的问题解决技巧。 这种思维模式看重的是速度、逻辑和准确性，还有甄别事实、对现有技术的重新应用和信息收集。 这种思维模式最重要的因素是：正确答案只有一个。你只需考虑两个答案，即对的或者是错的。 这种思维模式与某些科学或标准程序不无关联。 这种思维类型的人具有逻辑思维，能够记得住模式、解决问题，还能进行科学测试。
mt: The convergent thinking mode is a problem-solving technique that involves combining different ideas or fields to find solutions. This mode of thinking values speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as fact-checking, reapplication of existing technology, and information collection. The most important factor in this mode of thinking is that there is only one correct answer. You only need to consider two answers, either right or wrong. This mode of thinking is associated with some science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, can remember patterns, solve problems, and perform scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: 录像的使用为阐释微表情（持续几毫秒的面部运动）带来了重大发现。 具体说来，据说可以通过正确解读微表情来判断一个人是否在撒谎。 奥利弗·萨克斯 (Oliver Sacks) 在他的论文《总统的演讲》中指出，那些因为脑损伤而无法理解语言的人仍然能够准确地判断说话人是否有诚意。 他甚至提出，这种理解人类行为的能力可能是家犬等动物共有的本领。
mt: The use of video recordings has brought major discoveries in the field of microexpressions (facial movements lasting a few milliseconds). Specifically, it is said that one can accurately judge whether a person is lying by correctly interpreting microexpressions. Oliver Sacks points out in his paper "Presidential Speeches" that those who are unable to understand language due to brain damage can still accurately judge the sincerity of the speaker. He even suggests that this ability to understand human behavior may be shared by animals such as dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: 当获取知识和进行学习的能力发生如上所述的变化时，获取知识的基本速率也相应地产生变化。 获取信息的方法不尽相同。压力不再存在于个人回忆中，但回忆文本的能力变得更加重要。 文艺复兴从根本上让学习和知识传播的方式产生了重大变化。
mt: When the ability to acquire knowledge and learn changes as described above, the basic rate of acquiring knowledge also changes accordingly. The way of acquiring information is not the same. Pressure no longer exists in personal memory, but the ability to remember texts becomes more important. The Renaissance fundamentally changed the way of learning and knowledge dissemination.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: 互联网结合了大众传播和人际传播的要素。 互联网的鲜明特点使其在用途和满足方式方面增添了额外的维度。 例如，“学习”和“交际”被认为是使用互联网的重要动机（詹姆斯等，1995）。 在研究受众对网站的反应时，艾麦和麦克德（1998 年）把“个人参与”和“持续的关系”也作为新的动机因素。
mt: The Internet combines the elements of mass communication and interpersonal communication. The distinctive features of the Internet add additional dimensions to the uses and gratifications of the Internet. For example, "learning" and "socializing" are considered to be important motives for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). In studying the audience's response to websites, Eme and MacDermid (1998) also considered "personal involvement" and "continuing relationships" as new motive factors.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: 哥特式风格在 10 - 11 世纪到 14 世纪达到顶峰。 起初，裙装深受东方拜占庭文化的影响。 然而，由于文化交流迟缓，西方的时尚可能落后 25 到 30 年。 随着中世纪走向末期，西欧人民逐渐发展出自己的风格。当时最大的进步之一就是十字军东征后，人们开始用纽扣来系衣服。
mt: Gothic style reached its peak in the 10th to 11th centuries and 14th centuries. At first, dresses were influenced by Eastern Byzantine culture. However, due to cultural exchange, Western fashion may have been behind Eastern fashion by 25 to 30 years. One of the biggest advances as the Middle Ages came to an end was the crossbow, which allowed people to shoot arrows from a distance. Another was the use of buttons to fasten clothing after the Crusades.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: 我们可以开始更环保地生活，加入环保运动，甚至可以成为环保积极分子，在一定程度上减少将来的灾难。 很多情况下这和症状疗法很相似。但是，如果我们不仅仅想要一个临时的解决方案的话，那么我们就应该找到问题的根源，并把它彻底根除。 显而易见，由于人类的科学和技术进步，世界发生了很大的变化，而人口过剩和人类奢侈的生活方式使问题变得更为严重。
mt: We can start living more sustainably, join the environmental movement, even become an environmental activist, and in some ways reduce future disasters. Many times this is similar to symptomatic treatment. But if we want a permanent solution, we should find the root of the problem and eliminate it. It is obvious that due to human scientific and technological progress, the world has changed a lot, and overpopulation and human luxurious lifestyle have made the problem worse.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: 权力的平衡是欧洲国家寻求维护全体欧洲国家国家主权的制度。 这种理念是，所有欧洲国家必须设法阻止某个国家/地区独自变得强大，因此，各国政府为了保持平衡经常更换盟友。 西班牙继承权之战标志着第一场以权力平衡为核心问题的战争。 这标志着一个重要的变化，因为欧洲大国将无法再以宗教战争为借口。因此，三十年战争将是最后一场被贴上宗教战争标签的战争。
mt: The balance of power is the system of European states seeking to maintain the sovereignty of all European states. This idea is that all European states must find ways to prevent any one state from becoming too powerful, so governments often change allies to maintain the balance. The Spanish Succession marked the first war fought over the balance of power. This marked an important change, because European powers could no longer use religious wars as an excuse. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: 在欧洲历史上的这段时期，已然富有而强大起来的天主教会受到了密切监督。 尽管欧洲各国语言和习俗各不相同，但一千多年来，基督教把它们联系在了一起。 从国王到平民，它遍布十方的力量影响着每一个人。 基督教的主要信条之一是财富应该用来减轻痛苦和贫困，而教会的货币基金就是专门为此而设立的。 教会中央集权制在罗马存在了一千多年，这种权力和金钱的集中让许多人开始质疑，他们是否遵守了这一信条。
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, was closely watched. Although the languages and customs of the various European countries were different, for over a thousand years, Christianity had linked them together. From kings to commoners, the power and money of the Church influenced everyone. One of the main tenets of Christianity is that wealth should be used to alleviate pain and poverty, and the Church's monetary fund was set up specifically for this purpose. The centralized power of the Church in Rome had existed for over a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money made many people begin to question whether they were following this tenet.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: 在 1789 年 10 月 6 日，受到惊吓的国王路易十六、王后玛丽·安托瓦内特和他们的两个孩子（11 岁的玛丽·特蕾莎和 4 岁的路易斯·查尔斯），以及国王的妹妹伊丽莎白夫人，被一群集市妇女从凡尔赛赶回了巴黎。 他们乘坐马车回到了巴黎，一群人包围了他们，大喊大叫地威胁国王和王后。 暴民强迫国王和王后把马车的窗户完全打开。 当着吓坏了的女王的面，有一名暴徒一度挥动一颗皇家卫士的头颅，这名卫士是在凡尔赛宫被杀害的。
mt: 1789 October 6, King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette and their two children (11-year-old Marie-Thérèse and 4-year-old Louis-Charles), and the king's sister Princess Elizabeth were frightened by a mob of market women from Versailles to Paris. They rode in a carriage back to Paris, where a crowd surrounded them, shouting threats at the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to open the carriage windows completely. In front of the terrified queen, one rioter once waved a royal guard's head, who was killed at Versailles.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: 敌对行动爆发后不久，英国开始对德国实施海上封锁。 他们切断了生死攸关的军事和民用物资供应。事实证明这一战略是有效的，尽管这样的封锁违反了在过去的两个世纪里，根据几项国际协定制定的已为大家普遍接受的国际法。 英国在国际水域布雷，防止任何船只进入整片海域，甚至对中立国船只也构成威胁。 因为对这一战略的响应有限，德国期望其无限制潜艇战也能有类似的响应。
mt: Shortly after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain began to impose a naval blockade on Germany. They cut off the vital military and civilian supplies. It proved to be an effective strategy, despite the fact that such a blockade violated the international law that had been accepted by all for the past two centuries, as set out in a number of international conventions. Britain laid mines in international waters, preventing any ships from entering the entire sea, even threatening neutral ships. Because of the limited response to this strategy, Germany hoped that its unrestricted submarine warfare would also have a similar response.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: 在美国的各个地区，约有 40 万例多发性硬化症 (MS) 病例，这一疾病已经成为中青年的主要神经系统疾病。 多发性硬化是一种影响中枢神经系统（由脑、脊髓和视神经组成）的疾病。 研究发现，女性患多发性硬化症 (MS) 的几率是男性的两倍。
mt: 40,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) are estimated to occur in the United States, making it the most common neurological disease of young adults. Multiple sclerosis is a disease that affects the central nervous system (brain, spinal cord and optic nerve). Research has found that women are twice as likely to develop multiple sclerosis (MS) as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: 研究发现，抑郁、恐惧以及把病情灾难化的情绪，在腰疼患者的疼痛和残疾中起到了中介作用。 只有杞人忧天思维的影响，而不是沮丧和恐惧的影响，才能有条件地每周定期进行结构性体育锻炼。 参与定期训练的人在对疼痛的被动感知方面需要更多支持，以帮助他们区分慢性疼痛和不适感与正常身体运动的区别。
mt: The study found that depression, fear and the tendency to catastrophize were mediators of pain and disability in patients with low back pain. Only the influence of the worry and rumination, and not the influence of depression and fear, could be conditionally conducted on a weekly basis for structured physical exercise. Participants in regular training need more support in the passive perception of pain to help them distinguish between chronic pain and discomfort and normal body movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: 现代击剑运动分为多个级别：有大学学生初步学习的级别，也有专业和奥林匹克竞技的级别。 这项运动主要以对决的形式进行，也就是一个击剑手与另一个击剑手进行对决。
mt: Fencing is divided into several levels: there is a level for beginners, a level for professionals and a level for Olympic competition. The sport is mainly performed in the form of a duel, that is, one fencer against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: 体内中毒可能不会立即显现出来，呕吐等症状十分普遍，因此不能立即作出诊断。 摄入毒物的最有力指示物可能是现场被打开的容器，里面装有药物或家用有毒化学品。 查看毒药上的标签，获得具体急救指引。
mt: Poisoning may not be immediately apparent, and vomiting is common, so diagnosis cannot be made immediately. The strongest indication of ingested poison may be an open container at the scene containing medication or household toxic chemicals. Check the label of the poison for specific first aid instructions.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: 要检查受害者，你必须先勘察现场，确保自身的安全。 靠近受害者时，需要注意其姿势和任何无意识的危险信号。 如果你想帮助别人时受伤，你只会使事情变得更糟。
mt: To check on the victim, you must first assess the scene and ensure your own safety.  Approach the victim cautiously, noting their position and any unconscious danger signals.  If you are injured while trying to help someone, you will only make things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: 还有许多社会和政治影响，例如度量单位的使用、从专制到共和制的转变、民族主义、相信国家不属于唯一的统治者而是属于人民。 此外，在革命之后，官职面向全体男性开放申请，这使得最有抱负、最成功之人有机会飞黄腾达。 军队亦然，因为军衔的高低不再基于等级，而是基于才干。 法国大革命也鼓舞了许多其他国家被压迫的工人阶级，开始他们自己的革命。
mt: There were also many social and political effects, such as the use of metric units, the transition from monarchy to republic, nationalism, the belief that the state does not belong to the sole ruler but to the people. Furthermore, after the revolution, positions were opened to all men to apply for, which allowed the most ambitious, most successful people to rise to the top. The military was also affected, as ranks were no longer based on class, but on merit. The French Revolution also inspired many other countries' working classes, who were oppressed, to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: 每个人都是社会的一份子，都会使用交通系统。而几乎每个人都对交通系统有怨言。 在发达国家，你甚少会听到关于水质或桥梁倒塌类似程度的投诉。 为什么交通系统会引起这样的投诉？为什么它们每天都会出故障？是交通工程师不称职吗？或者是有更根本的原因？
mt: Everyone is a member of society, and everyone uses the transportation system. And almost everyone has complaints about the transportation system. In developed countries, you rarely hear complaints about water quality or bridges collapsing to the same degree. Why does the transportation system generate such complaints? Why does it fail so often? Is it because transportation engineers are incompetent? Or is there a more fundamental reason?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: 交通流量研究的是驾驶员和车辆在两点之间的运动，以及它们之间的相互作用。 遗憾的是，研究车流很困难，因为不能对驾驶员的行为进行百分之百确定的预测。 幸运的是，司机的行为往往在一个合理的一致性范围内；因此，交通流量往往具有一定的合理一致性，可以粗略地用数学方式表示。 为了更好地表示交通流量，在以下三个主要特征之间建立了关系：(1) 流量、(2) 密度和 (3) 速度。 这些关系对道路设施的规划、设计和运营有帮助。
mt: Traffic flow research is the movement of drivers and vehicles between two points, and their interaction. Unfortunately, it is difficult to predict the behavior of drivers with certainty. Fortunately, the behavior of drivers is often within a reasonable consistency range; therefore, traffic flow is often reasonably consistent and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships are established between the following three main features: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in the planning, design, and operation of road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: 赫希及崔斯（Hershey and Chase）的实验，是说明 DNA 是遗传物质的主要迹象依据之一。 赫尔希和蔡斯利用噬菌体或病毒，将他们自己的 DNA 植入到细菌之中。 他们做了两个实验，一个是用放射性磷标记噬菌体的 DNA，一个是用放射性硫标记噬菌体的蛋白质。
mt: 1. Hershey and Chase's experiment is one of the main evidence to prove that DNA is the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used bacteriophages or viruses to insert their own DNA into bacteria. They did two experiments, one is to use radioactive phosphorus to label the DNA of the bacteriophage, and the other is to use radioactive sulfur to label the protein of the bacteriophage.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: 突变会产生各种各样不同的影响，这取决于突变的类型、受影响遗传物质的重要性以及受影响的细胞是否为生殖系细胞。 只有生殖细胞的突变才会遗传给孩子，而其他细胞的突变则会导致细胞死亡或癌症。
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects, depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected genetic material, and whether the affected cell is a germ cell. Only mutations in germ cells will be inherited by children, while other mutations will cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: 山羊似乎是 1 万年前左右在伊朗的扎格罗斯山脉首次被驯养的。 古代文明和部落开始驯养它们，食用和使用它们的奶、肉、毛和皮。 家山羊通常被成群放牧在山上或其他牧区，它们通常由牧山羊人（大多为儿童或青少年）照管，牧山羊人与更广为人知的牧羊人类似。这些放牧方法至今仍在使用。
mt: Goats were apparently first domesticated in the Zagros Mountains of Iran around 10,000 years ago. Ancient civilizations and tribes began to domesticate them for food and use their milk, meat, hair, and skin. Domestic goats are usually herded in groups on mountains or other pastures and are usually tended by herdboys (mostly children or teenagers), who are similar to the more widely known herders. These herding methods are still in use today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: 高尔夫是一项玩家用球杆将球击入洞中的运动。 常规比赛一轮要打十八洞，球员通常从球场的第一洞开始，到第十八洞结束。 以最少击球次数或挥棒次数完成比赛的选手获胜。 比赛是在草地上进行的，洞周围的草被修剪得更短，被称为果岭。
mt: Golf is a sport in which players use a club to hit a ball into a hole. A regular round of golf is played over 18 holes, and players typically start at the first hole and end at the eighteenth. The winner is the player who completes the course in the fewest strokes or swings. The course is played on grass, with the grass around the holes being cut shorter, and being called the fairway.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

mt: Golf is a sport in which players use a club to hit a ball into a hole. A regular round of golf is played over 18 holes, and players typically start at the first hole and end at the eighteenth. The winner is the player who completes the course in the fewest strokes or swings. The course is played on grass, with the grass around the holes being cut shorter, and being called the fairway.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: 科学的主要目的是通过科学方法找出世界的运行方式。实际上，这种方法可为大多数科学研究提供指导。 实验是一种用来消除一个或多个可能性假设的试验，不过，实验并不是唯一的方法。提出问题及进行观察也可以指导科学研究。
mt: The main purpose of science is to find out how the world works. In fact, this method can provide guidance for most scientific research. An experiment is a test to eliminate one or more possible hypotheses, but an experiment is not the only way. Asking questions and observing can also guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: 与其他猛烈的风暴相比，龙卷风袭击的区域较小，但可以摧毁途经的一切。 龙卷风能将树木连根拔起，将建筑物上的木板撕下，把汽车抛向天空。龙卷风中的百分之二最为猛烈，能持续肆虐三小时以上。 这些怪物般的风暴，风速高达每小时 480 公里（133 m/s; 300 mph）。
mt: While other storms are large and fierce, tornadoes are small and devastating. They can rip trees from the ground, tear off the siding of buildings, and toss cars into the air. The most violent tornadoes can last for more than three hours and can reach speeds of up to 480 kilometers per hour (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: 几千年来，人类一直在制作和使用放大镜。 然而，第一个真正的望远镜是 16 世纪晚期在欧洲制造的。 这些望远镜使用了两个透镜的组合，使远处的物体看起来既近又大。
mt: For thousands of years, humans have been making and using magnifying glasses. However, the first true telescope was made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects look both near and large.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: 穆罕默德对尘世生活之外的事十分感兴趣。他以前经常到“努尔”（光明）山上一个叫做”希拉“的山洞里去冥想。 该洞穴本身，不仅经受住时间考验而保留下来，还为穆罕默德的灵性意向带来极其生动的形象。 该洞穴坐落在麦加 (Mecca) 北部的一座山顶上，与外界完全隔绝。 事实上，即使知道它的存在，也不容易找到。一旦进入洞穴，就完全与世隔绝了。 除了清澈美丽的天空和周围的群山，什么也看不见。在洞穴中，几乎看不到也听不到外界的景象和声音。
mt: Muhammad was interested in things beyond the world. He often went to a cave called Hira on Mount Nur (Light) to meditate. The cave itself, not only has withstood the test of time and remained intact, but also brought very vivid images to Muhammad's spiritual intent. The cave is located on the top of a mountain in the north of Mecca (Mecca), completely isolated from the outside world. In fact, even if you know it exists, it is not easy to find. Once you enter the cave, you are completely isolated from the outside world. Except for the clear and beautiful sky and the surrounding mountains, nothing can be seen. In the cave, you can hardly see or hear the scenery and sounds of the outside world.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: 英国早在 16 世纪就修建了货车道。 虽然马拉轨道车只是由平行的木板拼成，但在当时，就略显坎坷的道路而言，这些车能让拉车的马跑得更快，拉得更多。 很早的时候就引进了轨枕，用于固定铁轨。但是，人们逐渐意识到，如果在铁轨上放上铁片，铁轨会更稳固有效。 这成了普遍做法，但铁片会使木制的马车轮子磨损更严重。 最终，木轮被铁轮所取代。1767 年，第一条全铁轨道问世。
mt: 16th century Britain built wagonways. Although the planks were simply laid parallel, the horses could run faster and pull more with the wagonways than on the rough roads of the time. Early on, sleepers were introduced to fix the rails. However, people gradually realized that if iron plates were placed on the rails, the rails would be more stable and effective. This became the general practice, but the iron plates would wear the wooden wheels of the horse-drawn carriages more severely. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first all-iron railway was born.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: 浪漫主义具有很强的文化决定论色彩。这源于歌德、费希特和施莱格尔等作家。 在浪漫主义的背景下，地理塑造了个体，随着时间的推移，与地理相关的习俗和文化出现了，这些习俗文化因为与社会所处的地方和谐相融，要比任意强加的法律好得多。
mt: 1. Romanticism has a strong cultural determinism. This is due to Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel and other writers. In the background of romanticism, geography shaped the individual, and with the passage of time, customs and culture related to geography appeared, which were better than arbitrary laws because they were in harmony with the place where society was located.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: 技术决定论是一个在实践中涵盖许多种思想的术语，包括技术推动论，技术必要论，以及一个严格的定义——人类命运是由与科学定律相关的背后逻辑及其在技术中的表现驱动的。 大多数对技术决定论的解释都包括这两个总体思路：一是技术本身的发展在很大程度上超越了文化或政治影响，二是技术反过来会对社会产生不受社会条件制约的内在“影响”。 例如，有人可能会说，汽车必然会促进道路的发展。 然而，仅为少数汽车架设全国公路网，这在经济上并不可行，因此新的生产方式应运而生，以求降低汽车的拥有成本。 大众汽车保有量较高还会导致更高的道路交通事故发生率，而这将推动发明用于修复伤者伤处的全新医疗技术。
mt: Technological determinism is a term that covers many different ideas in practice, including technological imperative, technological necessity, and a strict definition: that human destiny is driven by the underlying logic and its manifestation in technology related to scientific laws. Most interpretations of technological determinism include these two general ideas: one, that the development of technology in large part transcends cultural or political influence, and two, that technology in turn will have an "impact" on society that is not subject to social conditions. For example, one might say that cars will promote the development of roads. However, it is not economically feasible to build a national highway network for only a few cars, so new modes of production are invented to lower the cost of owning a car. The high ownership rate of cars will lead to a higher rate of road traffic accidents, which will in turn drive the invention of new medical technology to repair injuries.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: “上弓”符号像字母 V，“下弓”符号像是钉书钉或是缺少了底边的正方形。 向上指的是从顶端开始推弓，向下指的是从弓根处（也就是手握弓的地方）开始拉弓。 上弓通常会发出更加柔和的声音，而下弓则会发出更强烈、更为坚定的声响。 请随意用铅笔作上你自己的标记，但要记住，印出来的音符是具有音乐意义的，所以它们通常应该被尊重。
mt: The "upbow" symbol looks like the letter V, and the "downbow" symbol looks like a nail or a square with the bottom edge missing. Upbow means to start the bow from the top, and downbow means to start the bow from the bow root (where the bow is held). Upbow usually produces a softer sound, and downbow produces a stronger, more definite sound. Feel free to make your own marks with a pencil, but remember that the printed notes have musical meaning, so they should usually be respected.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: 原始人类与其他灵长类动物不同的地方在于，他们不再用双手移动身体、托起重物、在树林里荡来荡去。 黑猩猩手脚的大小和长度相似，这反映出手在指背行走中用来承重的事实。 人类的手比脚短，指（趾）骨更直。 200 万到 300 万年前的手骨化石，都无不体现出手部特征，从移动方式到操作方式，经历了改变。
mt: The original difference between humans and other primates is that they no longer use their hands to move their bodies, lift objects, or swing through the trees. The black ape's hands and feet are similar in size and length, reflecting the fact that the hands are used to support the weight of the body. Human hands are shorter than feet, and the phalanges are more straight. The hand bones of 200 to 300 million years ago all show the characteristics of the hand, from the way of movement to the way of operation, have undergone changes.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: 二十世纪的研究表明，基因变异有两种库：显性和隐性。 突变会添加新的基因变异，而选择则会从表达的基因变异池中把变异移除。 由于分离和重组，变异在每一代的两个库之间来回变动。
mt: 20th century research showed that genetic variation comes in two pools: mutations add new genetic variants, while selection removes variants from the expressed gene pool. Variants move back and forth between the two pools through recombination and segregation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: 二十世纪的研究表明，基因变异有两种库：显性和隐性。 突变会添加新的基因变异，而选择则会从表达的基因变异池中把变异移除。 由于分离和重组，变异在每一代的两个库之间来回变动。
mt: 20th century research showed that genetic variation comes in two pools: mutations add new genetic variants, while selection removes variants from the expressed gene pool. Variants move back and forth between the two pools through recombination and segregation.

Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: 在热带草原上，灵长类动物拥有类似人类的消化系统，现有的植物资源很难满足灵长类动物对氨基酸的需求。 此外，如果做不到这一点将会带来严重的后果：生长抑制、营养不良，最终导致死亡。 最容易获得的植物性资源应该是叶子和豆科植物中的蛋白质，但像我们这样的灵长类动物很难消化这种蛋白质，除非是煮熟的。 相比之下，动物性食物（蚂蚁、白蚁、蛋）不仅容易消化，而且能提供大量蛋白质，里面含有全部必需的氨基酸。 综上所述，如果我们的祖先解决“蛋白质问题”的途径与如今热带草原上的黑猩猩所使用的方法无异，我们也不应该感到惊讶。
mt: On tropical savannas, primates have a similar digestive system to humans, and the available plant resources are difficult to meet the demand for amino acids. In addition, if this cannot be done, there will be serious consequences: growth inhibition, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The easiest to obtain plant resources should be leaves and legumes containing protein, but like us, primates have difficulty digesting this protein unless it is cooked. In contrast, animal food (ants, termites, eggs) is not only easy to digest, but also provides a large amount of protein, containing all the essential amino acids. In short, if our ancestors solved the "protein problem" in the same way as the black monkeys on today's tropical savannas, we should not be surprised.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: 亚文化让志同道合的个人团结起来，这些人感到自己被社会标准所忽视，亚文化在他们之间培养出一种认同感。 鉴于成员的年龄、种族、阶级、位置以及/或性别差异，亚文化可能会各具特色。 让亚文化变得与众不同的特质，可能是语言、美学、宗教、政治、性别、地理或多种因素的组合。 亚文化群体的成员，常常会象征性地利用独特的行事风格来表明他们的成员身份，包括时尚服装、举止和黑话。
mt: Subcultures allow like-minded individuals to bond together, people who feel overlooked by societal standards. Subcultures can vary in their features due to differences in age, race, class, location, and/or gender. What makes a subculture unique can be a combination of language, aesthetics, religion, politics, gender, geography, or other factors. Members of subcultures often symbolically use unique styles to indicate their membership, including fashion clothing, mannerisms, and slang.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: 孩子还小的时候，就能意识到种族和种族刻板印象，这些种族刻板印象会影响其行为。 例如，如果人们模式化地认为某个少数族裔的孩子在学校表现不好，那么这些孩子一旦了解了关于自己族裔的模式化观念，他们在学校往往就有不好的表现。
mt: Children as young as 5 can be aware of racial stereotypes and how they affect their behavior, according to a new study. For example, if people stereotype a minority child as doing poorly in school, once the child learns about the stereotype, they tend to do poorly in school.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: 孩子还小的时候，就能意识到种族和种族刻板印象，这些种族刻板印象会影响其行为。 例如，如果人们模式化地认为某个少数族裔的孩子在学校表现不好，那么这些孩子一旦了解了关于自己族裔的模式化观念，他们在学校往往就有不好的表现。
mt: Children as young as 5 can be aware of racial stereotypes and how they affect their behavior, according to a new study. For example, if people stereotype a minority child as doing poorly in school, once the child learns about the stereotype, they tend to do poorly in school.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: 要说明社会化的重要性，最常用的方法之一是利用少数不幸儿童的案例。这些儿童由于被忽视、遭遇不幸或遭到故意虐待，在成长过程中没有在成年人的帮助下实现社会化。 这样的孩子被称为“野孩”，意思是野孩子。 有些野孩子被人们（通常是他们自己的父母）所幽禁； 在某些情况下，孩子被遗弃是由于父母拒绝接受孩子有智力或身体上的严重缺陷。 野孩子在被抛弃或离家出走之前，可能经历过严重的儿童虐待或创伤。 据说，其他人是被动物养大的；有些人独自生活在野外。 狼孩如果完全由非人类的动物抚养长大，其行为（在身体条件允许的范围内）会与该动物非常雷同，比如会对人类表现出恐惧或冷漠。
mt: To explain the importance of socialization, one of the most common methods is to use the case of unfortunate children. These children, due to being neglected, unfortunate or intentionally abused, have not achieved socialization in the process of growing up with the help of adults. Such children are called "wild children". Some wild children are imprisoned by people (usually their own parents); in some cases, children are abandoned because their parents refuse to accept that they have severe mental or physical disabilities. Wild children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away from home. It is said that others were raised by animals; some people lived alone in the wild. Wolf children, if completely raised by non-human animals, will behave (within the range allowed by their physical condition) very similar to that animal, such as showing fear or indifference to humans.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: 自给农业，是为了生产仅能满足农业者及其家人所需的食物而进行的农业活动。 自给农业是一种简单且通常是有机的系统，利用该生态区内保存的本地种子，与农作物轮作或其他相对简单的技术相结合，从而最大限度地提高产量。 从历史上看，大部分农民从事的都是自给自足的农业生产。如今在很多发展中国家，情况依然如此。
mt: Self-sufficient agriculture is the practice of producing only enough food to feed the farmer and his family. Self-sufficient agriculture is a simple and often organic system that uses local seeds stored in the region and combines them with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically, most farmers have been involved in self-sufficient agriculture. This is still the case in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: 也许最常见的旅游类型，也是大多数人一想到旅游就会想到的：休闲旅游。 这是指人们去一个与他们日常生活截然不同的地方进行放松和娱乐。 海滩、主题公园和露营地通常是休闲游客最常光顾的地方。 如果一个人访问一个特定地方的目的是了解它的历史和文化，那么这种类型的旅游活动就被称为文化旅游。 游客可能会参观特定国家的不同地标，也可能只集中游览一个地区。
mt: 1. The most common type of tourism is also the one that most people think of when they think of tourism: leisure tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their everyday life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks, and campgrounds are usually the most visited places by leisure tourists. If someone's purpose of visiting a particular place is to learn about its history and culture, then this type of tourism activity is called cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country, or they may only focus on touring one region.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: 参与了几十年的人士帮助我们认识到自己的长处和热情所在，同时坦诚地评估困难，甚至是失败。 在听取别人分享他们个人、家庭和组织的故事时，我们对过去以及一些对组织文化有或好或坏影响的人物有了宝贵的认识。 虽然理解历史并不意味着理解文化，但至少可以帮助人们了解自己在组织历史中的位置。 在总结成功和失败时，个人和所有参与者会对组织的价值观、使命和驱动力有更深刻的认识。 在这种情况下，回顾之前的创业行为和取得的成功可以帮助人们对当地教会的新变化和新方向保持开放的态度。 这样的成功故事让人们对变化的恐惧感减轻了，同时为未来的变革营造出正面的倾向。
mt: Those who have participated for decades have helped us recognize our strengths and passions while honestly assessing the difficulties, even failures. In listening to people share their personal, family, and organizational stories, we have gained valuable insights into the past and some of the people who have had a positive or negative impact on organizational culture. While understanding history does not mean understanding culture, at least it can help people understand their place in the organization's history. In summarizing successes and failures, individuals and all participants will have a deeper understanding of the organization's values, mission, and driving forces. In this case, reviewing past entrepreneurial behaviors and successes can help people maintain an open attitude toward new changes and directions in the local church. Such success stories help people reduce their fear of change while creating a positive inclination for the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
