src: 1963 年大坝建成后，季节性洪水被控制住了，沉积物不再冲散到河流里。 这种沉积物是形成沙洲和海滩的必要条件，而沙洲和海滩是野生动物的栖息地。 结果，两种鱼类灭绝，另外两种鱼类濒临灭绝，其中包括弓背鲑。 虽然在洪水过后，水位只会上升几英尺，但官员们希望这足以恢复下游被侵蚀的沙洲。
mt: 1963, the dam was completed, seasonal floods were controlled, sediment no longer dispersed in the river. This sediment is a necessary condition for the formation of sandbars and beaches, and sandbars and beaches are the habitat of wild animals. As a result, two fish species have become extinct, and two fish species are on the verge of extinction, including the bowback salmon. Although the water level will only rise a few feet after the flood, officials hope this will be enough to restore the sandbars eroded downstream.
ref: After the dam was built in 1963, the seasonal floods that would spread sediment throughout the river were halted. This sediment was necessary for creating sandbars and beaches, which served as wildlife habitats. As a result, two fish species have become extinct, and two others have become endangered, including the humpback chub. Although the water level will only rise a few feet after the flood, officials are hoping it will be enough to restore eroded sandbars downstream.

src: 位于肯尼亚内罗毕的美国大使馆发出了警告称，“索马里极端分子”正策划在肯尼亚和埃塞俄比亚发动自杀性炸弹袭击。 “美国表示，他们收到了来自一名不愿公开身份的人士提供的信息，其中专门提到了通过自杀炸弹袭击者炸毁埃塞俄比亚和肯尼亚的‘著名地标’。”
mt: The U.S. Embassy in Nairobi, Kenya, issued a warning that "extremists" in Somalia were planning suicide bombings in Kenya and Ethiopia. "The United States received information from an unidentified person that the extremists were targeting 'landmarks' in Ethiopia and Kenya with suicide bombers," the embassy said.
ref: "The United States embassy located in Nairobi, Kenya has issued a warning that ""extremists from Somalia"" are planning to launch suicide bomb attacks in Kenya and Ethiopia. The U.S. says it has received information from an undisclosed source that specifically mentions the use of suicide bombers to will blow up ""prominent landmarks"" in Ethiopia and Kenya."

src: 位于肯尼亚内罗毕的美国大使馆发出了警告称，“索马里极端分子”正策划在肯尼亚和埃塞俄比亚发动自杀性炸弹袭击。 “美国表示，他们收到了来自一名不愿公开身份的人士提供的信息，其中专门提到了通过自杀炸弹袭击者炸毁埃塞俄比亚和肯尼亚的‘著名地标’。”
mt: The U.S. Embassy in Nairobi, Kenya, issued a warning that "extremists" in Somalia were planning suicide bombings in Kenya and Ethiopia. "The United States received information from an unidentified person that the extremists were targeting 'landmarks' in Ethiopia and Kenya with suicide bombers," the embassy said.
ref: "The United States embassy located in Nairobi, Kenya has issued a warning that ""extremists from Somalia"" are planning to launch suicide bomb attacks in Kenya and Ethiopia. The U.S. says it has received information from an undisclosed source that specifically mentions the use of suicide bombers to will blow up ""prominent landmarks"" in Ethiopia and Kenya."

src: 希腊著名律师萨基斯·科查吉欧格鲁 (Sakis Kechagioglou) 和乔治·尼可拉考普洛斯 (George Nikolakopoulos) 因被判贪污和腐败被关押在雅典的 Korydallus 监狱。 因此，随着法官、律师、法务官和检察官前几年的非法勾当曝光于世，在希腊法律界引发了一场大丑闻。 几周前，议员兼律师马基斯·特里安塔菲洛普洛斯在阿尔法电视台的热门电视节目《Zoungla》中公布了这一消息，随后彼得罗斯·曼图瓦洛斯因其办公室成员涉嫌非法贪污受贿而被革职。 此外，最高法官埃万杰洛斯·卡卢西斯因腐败和堕落行为被判入狱。
mt: Notable Greek lawyer Sakis Kechagioglou and George Nikolakopoulos were imprisoned in Korydallus prison in Athens for being convicted of corruption and bribery. Thus, with the exposure of the illegal dealings of the previous years of judges, lawyers, prosecutors and public prosecutors in the Greek legal system, a major scandal was sparked. A few weeks ago, MP and lawyer Makis Triantafilopoulos revealed this on the popular TV show "Zoungla" on Alpha TV, and Peteros Mantuvalos was dismissed from his office for his office members being involved in illegal bribery. In addition, Supreme Court Judge Evangelos Kalousis was sentenced to prison for corruption and debauchery.
ref: "The famous Greek lawyers, Sakis Kechagioglou and George Nikolakopoulos have been imprisoned in the Athens' jail of Korydallus, as they were found guilty of graft and corruption. As a result of this, a big scandal within the Greek legal community has been raised through the exposure of illegal actions that judges, lawyers, solicitors and attorneys have done during the previous years. A few weeks ago, after the information published by the journalist Makis Triantafylopoulos in his popular Television show ""Zoungla"" in Alpha TV, the member of Parliament and lawyer, Petros Mantouvalos was abdicated as members of his office had been involved in illegal graft and corruption. Moreover, top judge Evangelos Kalousis is imprisoned as he found guilty of corruption and degenerate behaviour."

src: 罗宾·乌萨帕 (Robin Uthappa) 取得了本局的最高分，投出了 11 个四分球和 2 个六分球，仅投出 41 个球便赢得 70 分。 中局击球手萨钦·坦杜尔卡和拉胡尔·德拉维德表现出色，搭档取得了 100 跑的成绩。 但在队长输掉三柱门后，印度在结束这一局的比赛时只得了 36 分，输掉 7 个三柱门。
mt: Robin Uthappa scored the highest score in the team, scoring 11 three-pointers and 2 six-pointers, scoring 70 points with only 41 shots.  Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid performed well as a pair, scoring 100 runs.  But after losing the three-point gate, India scored only 36 points in the end of the game, losing 7 three-point gates.
ref: Robin Uthappa made the innings highest score, 70 runs in just 41 balls by hitting 11 fours and 2 sixes. Middle order batsmen, Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid, performed well and made a hundred-run partnership. But, after losing the captain's wicket India only made 36 runs loosing 7 wickets to end the innings.

src: 共享资源管理员亚当·库尔登 (Adam Cuerden) 上个月在接受维基新闻 (Wikinews) 采访时表达了他对删除相关内容的不满。 “说穿了，他[威尔斯]从一开始就对我们撒谎。首先，他表现得好像是出于法律原因才这么做。其次，他先是假装听取我们的意见，然后直接删除了这些艺术作品。” 由于民愤，目前正在针对该网站的性内容起草相关政策。该网站拥有数百万个获得公共传播许可的媒体。
mt: Wikimedia Commons administrator Adam Cuerden expressed his displeasure with the removal of the content last month in an interview with Wikinews. "He [Wales] lied to us from the beginning. First, he made it seem like he was doing it for legal reasons. Second, he pretended to listen to our concerns, then he just deleted the art." Due to public outcry, a policy on the site's sexual content is being drafted. The site has millions of media with public domain licenses.
ref: "Commons Administrator Adam Cuerden expressed his frustration over the deletions when he spoke to Wikinews last month. ""He [Wales] basically lied to us from the start. First, by acting as if this was for legal reasons. Second, by pretending he was listening to us, right up to his art deletion."" The community irritation led to current efforts to draft a policy regarding sexual content for the site which hosts millions of openly-licensed media."

src: 并非所有人都支持女性参赛。 2004 年奥运会银牌得主阿米尔·可汗（Amir Khan）表示：“在内心深处，我认为女人不应该参加比赛。这是我的观点。” 尽管他如此评说，他表示会支持英国选手参加伦敦主办的 2012 年奥运会。
mt: 2004 Olympic silver medalist Amir Khan said, "In my heart, I think women shouldn't compete. That's my opinion." Despite his opinion, he said he would support British athletes at the 2012 London Olympics.
ref: "Not all were supportive of the inclusion of the women’s ranks. 2004 Olympic silver medallist Amir Khan said, ""Deep down I think women shouldn’t fight. That’s my opinion."" Despite his comments he said he will be supporting the British competitors at the 2012 Olympics being held in London."

src: 13 岁的摩托车赛车手彼得·伦茨在印第安纳波利斯赛车场上发生车祸丧生。 在赛道上热身时，伦茨 (Lenz) 从自行车上摔了下来，然后被跟在后面的赛车手泽维尔·扎亚特 (Xavier Zayat) 撞到。 当时，在场的医务人员立即对他进行了抢救，并将他送往当地一家医院，后来他因救治无效身亡。 遭遇事故的扎亚特没有受伤。
mt: 13-year-old motorcycle racer Peter Lenz died in a crash at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Lenz fell off his bike while warming up on the track, then was hit by following racer Xavier Zayat. At the time, medical personnel on the scene immediately began resuscitation efforts and transported him to a local hospital, where he later died despite efforts to save him. Zayat was not injured in the accident.
ref: Peter Lenz, a 13-year-old motorcycle racer, has died after being involved in a crash at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. While on his warm-up lap, Lenz fell off his bike, and was then struck by fellow racer Xavier Zayat. He was immediately attended to by the on-track medical staff and transported to a local hospital where he later died. Zayat was unhurt in the accident.

src: 对于各个年龄和背景的人来说，乘飞机旅行都可能成为恐怖的经历，尤其是在以前从未乘坐过飞机或有过痛苦经历的情况下。 这并不是丢人的事情：这和很多人对其他东西抱有的恐惧和厌恶没什么两样。 对一些人来说，如果要克服因未知事物或不可控制的状况而产生的恐惧，了解飞机的工作原理和飞行的程序可能会有帮助。
mt: For many people, flying on an airplane can be a terrifying experience, especially for those who have never flown before or have had a bad experience. This is not something to be ashamed of: it is much the same as many people's fears and aversions to other things. For some people, understanding how airplanes work and the procedures involved in flying may help overcome fears of the unknown or uncontrollable.
ref: Travelling by plane can be a scary experience for people of all ages and backgrounds, particularly if they've not flown before or have experienced a traumatic event. It is not something to be ashamed of: it is no different from the personal fears and dislikes of other things that very many people have. For some, understanding something about how aircraft work and what happens during a flight may help to overcome a fear which is based on the unknown or on not being in control.

src: 现在已经很少有人不先搜索和比较价格，就直接通过航空公司订票了。 有时，同一航班在不同信息汇集网站上的价格可能相差很大，在预订前先比较搜索结果，同时看看航空公司自己的网站，是有好处的。
mt: It is now rare for people to book flights directly with airlines without first searching and comparing prices. Sometimes, the price of the same flight can vary greatly on different information aggregation websites, so it is a good idea to compare the search results and check the airline's own website before booking.
ref: Nowadays air travel is only rarely booked directly through the airline without first searching and comparing prices. Sometimes the same flight can have vastly differing prices at various agregators and it pays to compare search results and to also look at the website of the airline itself before booking.

src: 快递公司可因快速交付货物而获取高酬劳。很多时候，时间对于商务文件、商品或用于紧急维修的零部件而言非常重要。 在某些航线上，大型公司有自己的飞机，但对于其他航线和小公司来说，就有问题了。 如果他们使用航空的方式运输货物，在某些航线上，可能要花几天的时间才能卸货和通关。 最快的方法就是把它作为托运行李承运。根据航空公司规定，禁止载运未登机旅客的行李，而这时就需要你在场。
mt: Express companies can earn high fees for fast delivery of goods. Many times, time is very important for business documents, goods or parts for emergency repair. For some routes, large companies have their own planes, but for other routes and small companies, there is a problem. If they use the way of aviation to transport goods, it may take a few days to unload and clear customs on some routes. The fastest way is to carry it as checked baggage. According to the regulations of the airline, it is prohibited to carry the luggage of passengers who have not boarded, and you need to be present at this time.
ref: Courier companies are well paid for delivering things quickly. Frequently, time is very important with business documents, merchandise or spare parts for an urgent repair. On some routes, the larger companies have their own planes, but for other routes and smaller firms there was a problem. If they sent things by air freight, on some routes it may have taken days to get through unloading and customs. The only way to get it through faster was to send it as checked luggage. Airline regulations will not allow them to send luggage without a passenger, which is where you come in.

src: 你务必谨慎选择联盟中的”飞行常客“航空公司。 虽然你可能会认为，乘坐哪家航空公司航班的次数最多就加入哪家航空公司的会员是很自然的事，但你应该知道，航空公司提供的权益往往不同，同一联盟下的其他航空公司可能会回馈更多常旅客积分。
mt: You should be careful when choosing an alliance's "frequent flyer" airline. While it may seem natural to join the airline with which you fly the most, you should know that the benefits offered by airlines can vary, and other airlines in the same alliance may reward frequent flyers with more miles.
ref: You should choose your Frequent Flyer airline in an alliance carefully. Although you may think it is intuitive to join the airline you fly most, you should be aware that privileges offered are often different and frequent flyer points may be more generous under a different airline in the same alliance.

src: 适量饮用含酒精的饮料。酒精对每个人的影响都不一样，了解自己的饮酒极限非常重要。 过量饮酒可能导致长期的健康问题，比如肝脏损伤， 甚至会导致失明和死亡。饮用非法生产的酒类时，潜在的危险性更大。 非法烈酒可能含有包括甲醇在内的各种危险杂质，即使小剂量也会导致失明或死亡。
mt: Drink in moderation. Alcohol affects people differently, and it’s important to know your limits. Drinking too much can lead to long-term health problems, such as liver damage, and even blindness and death. Drinking bootleg alcohol is even more dangerous. Bootleg alcohol can contain dangerous contaminants, such as methanol, even in small doses, and can cause blindness or death.
ref: Drink alcoholic drinks with moderation. Alcohol affects everyone differently, and knowing your limit is very important. Possible long term health events from excessive drinking can include liver damage and even blindness and death. The potential danger is increased when consuming illegally produced alcohol. Illegal spirits can contain various dangerous impurities including methanol, which can cause blindness or death even in small doses.

src: 运河区（荷兰语：Grachtengordel）是阿姆斯特丹宾嫩斯塔 (Binnenstad) 周围著名的 17 世纪老城区。 由于独特的文化和历史价值，整个地区被联合国教科文组织列为世界遗产，该区的房产价值位居该国的最高之列。
mt: The Grachtengordel (Canal District) is the famous 17th-century old city centre around the Binnenstad (Inner City) of Amsterdam. Due to its unique cultural and historical value, the entire area is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and its real estate is among the most expensive in the country.
ref: The Canal District (Dutch: Grachtengordel) is the famous 17th-century district surrounding the Binnenstad of Amsterdam. The whole district is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its unique cultural and historical value, and its property values are among the highest of the country.

Due to its unique cultural and historical value, the entire area is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and its real estate is among the most expensive in the country.
ref: The Canal District (Dutch: Grachtengordel) is the famous 17th-century district surrounding the Binnenstad of Amsterdam. The whole district is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its unique cultural and historical value, and its property values are among the highest of the country.

src: 格罗姆寺位于暹粒市西南 12 公里处。这座山顶寺庙建于 9 世纪末耶输跋摩国王统治时期。 寺庙阴郁的氛围和洞里萨湖（Tonle Sap）的景色，让人感到爬到山顶是值得的。 参观景点时，还可以顺便乘船游湖。 需要购买吴哥门票才能进入圣殿，所以前往洞里萨湖（Tonle Sap）时别忘了带上护照。
mt: 12 kilometers southwest of Siem Reap, the temple of Preah Ko is located on top of a hill. Built in the late 9th century during the reign of King Yashovarman II, the temple's somber atmosphere and views of Tonle Sap Lake make the climb worthwhile. Visitors can also take a boat ride on the lake. A pass to Angkor is required to enter the temple, so don't forget your passport when visiting Tonle Sap Lake.
ref: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman. The gloomy atmosphere of the temple and the view over the Tonle Sap lake make the climb to the hill worthwhile. A visit to the site can be conveniently combined with a boat trip to the lake. The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap.

src: 南极洲环绕着南极，是地球上最冷的地方。 旅行费用高昂，对身体素质要求也很高，并且只能在十一月至次年二月的夏季前往，游览地点主要限于半岛、群岛和罗斯海。 在夏天，这里的四十余个基地会迎来几千名工作人员，其中的大多数人驻扎在此地区；一小部分人留下越冬。 南极洲内陆是一片荒凉的高原，为 2-3 千米厚的冰所覆盖。 偶尔会有专门的航空旅行团前往内陆旅行，参加登山活动，或前往南北极的大型基地。
mt: Antarctica is surrounded by the South Pole, the coldest place on Earth. Travel costs are high, and the physical requirements are high, and can only be visited from November to the following February's summer. The main tourist destinations are the peninsula, islands and Ross Sea. In the summer, the forty or so bases will welcome several thousand workers, most of whom are stationed in this area; a small number of people stay over the winter. The interior of Antarctica is a barren plateau covered by 2-3 kilometers of ice. Occasionally, there are special air travel teams to the interior travel, participate in mountaineering activities, or to the South and North Pole large base.
ref: Antarctica is the coldest place on Earth, and surrounds the South Pole. Tourist visits are costly, demand physical fitness, can only take place in summer Nov-Feb, and are largely limited to the Peninsula, Islands and Ross Sea. A couple of thousand staff live here in summer in some four dozen bases mostly in those areas; a small number stay over winter. Inland Antarctica is a desolate plateau covered by 2-3 km of ice. Occasional specialist air tours go inland, for mountaineering or to reach the Pole, which has a large base.

src: 如今，前现代的天文台大多已经被淘汰，只作为博物馆或教育场所保留了下来。 由于在其全盛时期的光污染还不像现在这么严重，所以天文台通常建立在城区或校园内，比现代修建的天文台更容易到达。 大多数现代科研望远镜都是巨型设施，位于大气条件优良的偏远地区。
mt: Today, most of the pre-modern observatories have been retired, and are now preserved as museums or educational sites.  Because light pollution was not as severe during their heyday as it is now, observatories were typically built in urban or campus settings, making them easier to access than modern observatories.  Most modern research telescopes are massive facilities, located in remote areas with excellent atmospheric conditions.
ref: Pre-modern observatories are usually obsolete today, and remain as museums, or sites of education. As light pollution in their heyday was not the kind of problem it is today, they are usually located in cities or at campuses, easier to reach than those built in modern times. Most modern research telescopes are enormous facilities in remote areas with favorable atmospheric conditions.

src: 奥克兰横跨两个港口，因此当地有很多海滩。其中最有人气的海滩分布在三个地区。 北岸海滩（位于北港区内）在太平洋上，从北部的长湾 (Long Bay) 一直延伸到南部的德文波特 (Devonport)。 这里几乎都是沙滩，游泳很安全，大部分地方都有新西兰圣诞树的树荫。 塔马基大道 (Tamaki Drive) 海滩位于怀特玛塔港 (Waitemata Harbour)，就在奥克兰中部的米森湾 (Mission Bay) 和圣赫里尔斯 (St Heliers) 的高档郊区。 这些海滩有时挤满了度假的家庭，沿岸排列着各种各样的商店。 游泳很安全。
mt: Oklahoma City is home to two major airports, Will Rogers World Airport and Tinker Air Force Base. Will Rogers World Airport is the main airport for the city, and is located just east of downtown Oklahoma City. Tinker Air Force Base is located just south of the city, and is home to the 72nd Air Base Wing of the United States Air Force. Both airports are served by major airlines, and offer a variety of flights to destinations both within the United States and internationally.
ref: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas. North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south. They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees. Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland. These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.

src: 请记住，你其实是在参观一个巨大的万人坑遗址，该遗址对世界上一大群体有着难以估量的意义。 还是有许多男女在这里幸存了下来，他们如今仍然健在；而更多人的亲人，有的在那里被屠杀，有的一直做苦工到死，犹太人和非犹太人都是如此。 请给予此地应得的尊严、庄严和尊重。不要用大屠杀或纳粹开玩笑。 切勿在建筑物上做标记或涂鸦，以免破坏遗址。
mt: Remember, you are actually visiting a mass grave site, which has an incalculable significance for a large group of people.  Still, many men and women survived here, and they are still alive today; and many more people's relatives were killed here, or worked to death, both Jewish and non-Jewish.  Please give this place the dignity, solemnity and respect it deserves.  Do not make jokes about the Holocaust or the Nazis.  Do not make graffiti or write on the buildings, as this will damage the site.
ref: Please remember that you are essentially visiting a mass grave site, as well as a site that has an almost incalculable meaning to a significant portion of the world's population. There are still many men and women alive who survived their time here, and many more who had loved ones who were murdered or worked to death there, Jews and non-Jews alike. Please treat the site with all of the dignity, solemnity and respect it deserves. Do not make jokes about the Holocaust or Nazis. Do not deface the site by marking or scratching graffiti into structures.

src: 辅助语言是为了便于语言不相通的人群交流而创造的人工语言或构造语言。 他们不同于通用语。通用语是一种自然的或逐步形成的语言，由于各种原因成为其他语言使用者之间交流的主要手段。
mt: Auxiliary languages are constructed or artificial languages created to facilitate communication between people of different native languages. They are distinct from universal languages. Universal languages are natural or gradually formed languages that become the primary means of communication between speakers of different native languages for various reasons.
ref: Auxiliary languages are artificial or constructed languages created with the intent of facilitating communication between peoples who would otherwise have difficulty communicating. They are separate from lingua francas, which are natural or organic languages that become dominant for one reason or another as means of communication between speakers of other languages.

They are separate from lingua francas, which are natural or organic languages that become dominant for one reason or another as means of communication between speakers of other languages.

src: 如果在冬天穿越北波罗的海，要检查客舱的位置，因为在冰面上航行会给那些受影响最严重的人带来非常可怕的噪音。 圣彼得堡游轮包括城内观光活动。游轮乘客可获豁免签证（详情请参阅服务条款）。
mt: If crossing the North Baltic Sea in winter, check the location of the cabin, as flying over the ice will bring very unpleasant noise to those affected most. The St. Petersburg cruise includes city sightseeing. Cruise passengers are exempt from visas (see terms and conditions).
ref: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected. Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).

ref: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected. Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).

src: 巴塞罗那的官方语言为加泰罗尼亚语和西班牙语。大约一半的当地人更愿意说加泰罗尼亚语，绝大多数人都听懂加泰罗尼亚语，至于西班牙语，几乎每个人都能听懂。 然而，大多数指示牌都只使用加泰罗尼亚语，因为这是法律规定的第一官方语言。 然而，公共交通和其他设施也广泛使用西班牙语。 地铁里的定期广播只有加泰罗尼亚语，但自动系统会用多种语言进行临时广播，包括西班牙语、英语、法语、阿拉伯语和日语。
mt: The official languages of Barcelona are Catalan and Spanish. About half of the locals prefer to speak Catalan, almost everyone understands Catalan, and almost everyone understands Spanish. However, most signs are in Catalan only, as this is the first official language by law. However, public transport and other facilities also use Spanish widely. The regular announcements on the metro are only in Catalan, but the automatic system will use several languages for temporary announcements, including Spanish, English, French, Arabic, and Japanese.
ref: Barcelona's official languages are Catalan and Spanish. About a half prefer to speak Catalan, a vast majority understands it, and virtually everyone knows Spanish. However, most signs are indicated only in Catalan because it is established by law as the first official language. Yet, Spanish is also widely used in public transport and other facilities. Regular announcements in the Metro are made only in Catalan, but unplanned disruptions are announced by an automated system in a wide variety of languages including Spanish, English, French, Arabic and Japanese.

src: 在当今发达国家，提供豪华民宿已经上升为一种艺术形式。 在高端市场上，显而易见，一众 B&B 公司主要在两个方面展开竞争：床铺和早餐。 因而在这般上佳之所里，人们往往会发现最奢华的床上用品，也许正是一条手工制作的被子，或者是一张年代久远的床榻。 早餐可能包括当地的时令美食或主人提供的特色菜。 场景可能是一栋有历史意义的古老建筑，有着古色古香的家具、修剪整齐的地面和游泳池。
mt: In today's developed countries, providing a luxurious bed and breakfast has become an art form. In the high-end market, it is obvious that B&B companies compete in two areas: bedding and breakfast. So in such a fine place, people often find the most luxurious bedding, perhaps a handmade quilt, or an antique bed. Breakfast may include seasonal local food or a specialty dish provided by the owner. The scene may be an old building with historical significance, with antique furniture, well-maintained floors and a swimming pool.
ref: In developed countries today, providing deluxe bed and breakfasts has been raised to a sort of art-form. At the top end, B&Bs obviously compete mainly on two main things: bedding and breakfast. Accordingly, at the finest such establishments one is apt to find the most luxurious bedding, maybe a handmade quilt or an antique bed. Breakfast may include seasonal delights of the region or the host's speciality dish. The setting might be an historic old building with antique furnishings, manicured grounds and a swimming pool.

src: 中国北京将成为 2022 年冬季奥运会的主办城市，这座城市也将因此成为第一个同时举办过夏季和冬季奥运会的城市。 北京将举办开幕式、闭幕式和室内滑冰赛事。 其他滑雪活动将在张家口太子城滑雪场举行，距离北京约 220 公里（140 英里）。
mt: Beijing will be the host city for the 2022 Winter Olympics, making it the first city to host both summer and winter games. Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies and indoor ice skating events. Other skiing events will be held at the Zhangjiakou Tushan Ski Resort, about 140 miles (220 kilometers) from Beijing.
ref: The city of Beijing in China will be the host city of the Olympic Winter Games in 2022, which will make it the first city to have hosted both the summer and winter Olympics. Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies and the indoor ice events. Other skiing events will be at the Taizicheng ski area in Zhangjiakou, about 220 km (140 miles) from Beijing.

src: 禽流感，或更正式地称之为 “家禽流行性感冒”，既能感染鸟类，又能感染哺乳动物。 据报道，人类感染禽流感的病例不到 一千例，但其中有一些病例是致命的。 大多数病例出自与家禽打交道的人群，但观鸟者也有一定风险。
mt: Avian flu, or more formally known as avian influenza, can infect both birds and mammals. There have been less than 1,000 reported cases of humans contracting avian flu, but some of those cases have been fatal. Most cases have come from people who work with poultry, but bird watchers also have some risk.
ref: Bird flu, or more formally avian influenza, can infect both birds and mammals. Fewer than a thousand cases have ever been reported in humans, but some of them have been fatal. Most have involved people who work with poultry, but there is also some risk to birdwatchers.

src: 禽流感，或更正式地称之为 “家禽流行性感冒”，既能感染鸟类，又能感染哺乳动物。 据报道，人类感染禽流感的病例不到 一千例，但其中有一些病例是致命的。 大多数病例出自与家禽打交道的人群，但观鸟者也有一定风险。
mt: Avian flu, or more formally known as avian influenza, can infect both birds and mammals. There have been less than 1,000 reported cases of humans contracting avian flu, but some of those cases have been fatal. Most cases have come from people who work with poultry, but bird watchers also have some risk.
ref: Bird flu, or more formally avian influenza, can infect both birds and mammals. Fewer than a thousand cases have ever been reported in humans, but some of them have been fatal. Most have involved people who work with poultry, but there is also some risk to birdwatchers.

src: 维京人利用俄罗斯水路到达黑海和里海。其中一些路线至今仍可通行。确认一下是否需要特殊许可证，这些许可证可能很难申请。 白令海峡经由奥内加湖（Lake Onega）、拉多加湖（Lake Ladoga）和圣彼得堡（Saint Petersburg）连接北冰洋和波罗的海，连接处多数是河流和湖泊。 奥内加湖 (Lake Onega) 也与伏尔加河 (Volga) 连接，因此可能可以从里海 (Caspian Sea) 经俄罗斯到达这里。
mt: The Vikings used Russian rivers to reach the Black Sea and the Caspian Sea. Some of these routes are still navigable. Check whether you need special permits, these permits may be difficult to obtain. The White Sea is connected to the Baltic Sea via the Onega Lake (Lake Onega), Ladoga Lake (Lake Ladoga) and Saint Petersburg (Saint Petersburg), most of the connection is rivers and lakes. The Onega Lake (Lake Onega) is also connected to the Volga River (Volga), so it may be possible to reach here from the Caspian Sea (Caspian Sea) through Russia.
ref: Vikings used the Russian waterways to get to the Black Sea and Caspian Sea. Parts of these routes can still be used. Check possible need for special permits, which may be difficult to get. The White Sea–Baltic Canal connects the Arctic Ocean to the Baltic Sea, via Lake Onega, Lake Ladoga and Saint Petersburg, mostly by rivers and lakes. Lake Onega is also connected to Volga, so coming from the Caspian Sea through Russia is still possible.

src: 入境检查站通常是走下飞机、轮船或其他交通工具后经过的第一站。 一些跨境列车的查验在车上进行；登上跨境列车时，应该携带有效的身份证件。 在夜间卧铺列车上，为了不影响乘客睡眠，列车长可能会提前收取护照。
mt: Border control is usually the first stop after getting off a plane, ship or other form of transportation. Some cross-border trains have checks done on board; when boarding a cross-border train, you should carry valid identification. On overnight sleeper trains, the conductor may collect passports in advance to avoid disturbing passengers' sleep.
ref: An immigration checkpoint is usually the first stop when disembarking from a plane, a ship, or another vehicle. In some cross-border trains inspections are done on the running train and you should have valid ID with you when boarding one of those trains. On night sleeper trains, passports may be collected by the conductor so that you do not have your sleep interrupted.

src: 通常来讲，新加坡是一个非常安全的地方，导航也很容易。到达后你几乎可以买到任何东西。 但由于处在赤道以北几度的“高热带”，你将需要同时应对高温（终年）和强烈的阳光（天气晴朗时，这种情况相对较少）。
mt: Singapore is usually a very safe place, and navigation is easy. After arriving, you can buy almost anything. But being a few degrees north of the equator, you will need to deal with both high temperatures (year-round) and strong sunlight (relatively rare when the weather is clear).
ref: "Singapore is generally an extremely safe place to be and very easy to navigate, and you can buy almost anything after arriving. But being placed in the ""high tropics"" just a few degrees north of equator you will need to deal with both heat (always) and strong sun (when the sky is clear, more rarely)."

src: 德国的糕点很不错，巴伐利亚的点心就更加丰富多彩，与他们南边的邻居奥地利很相似。 水果点心很常见，苹果全年都能用来做点心，夏天还能吃到樱桃和李子。 许多德国烘焙食品也以杏仁、榛子和其他坚果为特色。受欢迎的蛋糕与浓咖啡往往是绝配。 如果你想来点风味浓郁的小点心，可以试试果酱包，这种甜点在不同地区有不同的称呼，如 Berliner、Pfannkuchen、Krapfen。
mt: German pastries are delicious, and the ones from Bavaria are even more colorful and similar to their southern neighbors, Austria. Fruit pastries are common, and apples can be used all year round, and cherries and plums are available in the summer. Many German baked goods also feature almonds, hazelnuts, and other nuts. A popular cake and coffee combination is often served together. If you want something a little more flavorful, try a fruit-filled pastry, which is known by different names in different regions, such as Berliner, Pfannkuchen, and Krapfen.
ref: German pastries are quite good, and in Bavaria, are quite rich and varied, similar to those of their southern neighbor, Austria. Fruit pastries are common, with apples cooked into pastries year round, and cherries and plums making their appearances during the summer. Many German baked goods also feature almonds, hazelnuts, and other tree nuts. Popular cakes often pair particularly well with a cup of strong coffee. If you want some small though rich pastries, try what depending on region are called Berliner, Pfannkuchen or Krapfen.

src: 无论是出于必要、还是为了换换生活方式、挑战自我，如果你想花最少的钱看世界，有些办法可以帮你做到。 基本上，它们可分为两类：要么边旅行边工作，要么尽量减少开支。这篇文章着重于后者。 对于那些愿意牺牲舒适度和时间，喜欢充满惊喜的旅行，并把开销降至接近于零的游客，请参阅《最低预算旅行攻略》。 该设想假定旅行者不会为了自己的利益而进行偷窃、非法侵入、参与非法市场、乞讨或为了私利剥削他人。
mt: Whether it's out of necessity, or to change up your lifestyle, or to challenge yourself, if you want to see the world on the cheap, there are some ways to do it. Basically, they can be broken down into two categories: either work while you travel, or try to minimize your expenses. This article focuses on the latter. For those willing to sacrifice comfort and time, who like the element of surprise in travel, and who want to keep their expenses close to zero, see the "Budget Travel Guide." The premise assumes that the traveler will not steal for his own benefit, break and enter, participate in the black market, beg, or exploit others for his own gain.
ref: If you want to see the world on the cheap, for necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are some ways to do that. Basically, they fall into two categories: Either work while you travel or try and limit your expenses. This article is focused on the latter. For those willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability to push expenses down close to zero, see minimum budget travel. The advice assumes that travellers do not steal, trespass, participate in the illegal market, beg, or otherwise exploit other people for their own gain.

src: 在布法罗-匹兹堡高速公路上，行车条件最具挑战性的是波特马里恩 (Point Marion) 到费尔蒙特 (Fairmont) 之间的路段，这段路频繁地途径多处偏僻的边远地区。 如果你不习惯在乡村道路上开车，那可要保持头脑清醒：这里到处都是陡坡、窄车道和急转弯。 该处公示的限速比之前和之后的路段明显要低，常见的限速是 35-40 英里/小时（56-64 公里/小时），而严格遵守限速要求的重要性也甚于其他路段。 不过，令人奇怪的是，这里的手机服务比沿途的许多其他路线（例如宾夕法尼亚州荒原）要强得多。
mt: The most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh highway are between Point Marion and Fairmont, where the road frequently passes through remote areas. If you're not used to driving on country roads, stay alert: there are steep hills, narrow lanes, and sharp turns everywhere. The posted speed limits are lower than the surrounding areas, and it's important to follow them strictly. However, it's strange that the cell service is better here than on many other routes through the Pennsylvania wilderness.
ref: The stretch between Point Marion and Fairmont presents the most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, passing frequently through isolated backwoods terrain. If you're not used to driving on country roads, keep your wits about you: steep grades, narrow lanes, and sharp curves predominate. Posted speed limits are noticeably lower than in previous and subsequent sections — commonly 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) — and strict obedience to them is even more important than otherwise. Curiously, though, mobile phone service is much stronger here than along many other stretches of the route, e.g. the Pennsylvania Wilds.

src: 溪降时要进入峡谷的底部，峡谷可以是干涸的，也可以有很深的水。 溪降结合了游泳、爬山和跳跃的元素——但只需要相对较少的训练和体能基础就可以入门（和攀岩、水肺潜水、高山滑雪等相比）。
mt: When you're rappelling into a canyon, the bottom of the canyon can be dry or have deep water. Rappelling combines elements of swimming, climbing, and jumping — but you can get started with relatively little training and fitness base (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving, and downhill skiing).
ref: Canyoning (or: canyoneering) is about going in a bottom of a canyon, which is either dry or full of water. Canyoning combines elements from swimming, climbing and jumping--but requires relatively little training or physical shape to get started (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).

src: 溪降时要进入峡谷的底部，峡谷可以是干涸的，也可以有很深的水。 溪降结合了游泳、爬山和跳跃的元素——但只需要相对较少的训练和体能基础就可以入门（和攀岩、水肺潜水、高山滑雪等相比）。

Canyoning combines elements from swimming, climbing and jumping--but requires relatively little training or physical shape to get started (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).

src: 坐进自己的车，开启一段漫长的公路之旅，本身就有一种简单纯粹的吸引力。 与大型车不同，你可能已经很熟悉驾驶自己的车，也知道它的局限。 在私人地产或任何规模的小镇上搭建帐篷，都很容易引起不必要的注意。 简而言之，开车是一种很棒的自驾游方式，但它本身不太适合“露营”。 如果你有一辆较大的小型面包车、运动型休旅车、轿车或旅行车，并且座椅可以放平，那么你就可以进行汽车露营。
mt: There's a certain simple, pure appeal to getting in your own car and hitting the road for a long stretch of highway. Unlike a large vehicle, you may already be familiar with driving your car and know its limitations. Setting up a tent on private property or in any small town is easy to avoid unnecessary attention. In short, driving is a great way to go camping, but it's not really suited to "camping." If you have a larger small van, SUV, sedan, or wagon and your seats can fold down, you can go car camping.
ref: "Getting into your own car and heading off on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity. Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably already familiar with driving your car and know its limitations. Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily attract unwanted attention. In short, using your car is a great way to take a road trip but seldom in itself a way to ""camp"". Car camping is possible if you have a large minivan, SUV, Sedan or Station Wagon with seats that lay down."

src: 现代城市卡萨布兰卡是由柏柏尔 (Berber) 渔民在公元前 10 世纪建立的，曾被腓尼基人、罗马人和马里尼德人 (Merenid) 用作战略港口，港口曾被称为安法 (Anfa)。 葡萄牙人毁灭了这座城并进行了重建，还将其命名为卡萨布兰卡 (Casa Branca) ，直到 1755 年地震后才遗弃了它。 摩洛哥苏丹将该市重建为 Daru l-Badya。西班牙商人在这里建立了贸易基地，并将其命名为卡萨布兰卡。 卡萨布兰卡是全摩洛哥最无趣的购物地之一。 在麦地那老城附近，出售塔吉锅、陶器、皮具、水烟等摩洛哥传统商品和各种小玩意儿的店铺随处可见，但这些商店都是针对游客的。
mt: Casablanca, the modern city, was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BC, and was used as a strategic port by the Phoenicians, Romans and Merenids. The port was called Anfa. The Portuguese destroyed the city and rebuilt it, naming it Casa Branca, until it was abandoned after the 1755 earthquake. The Sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya. Spanish merchants established a trading post and named it Casablanca. Casablanca is one of the least interesting shopping places in all of Morocco. Shops selling Moroccan traditional goods such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, water pipes, and various small items can be found everywhere in the old medina of Mecca, but these shops are aimed at tourists.
ref: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa. The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755. The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there. Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco. Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.

src: 向北可轻松抵达浪漫迷人的辛特拉镇；它是拜伦勋爵笔下为人称道的乐土，并因此为外国人所熟知。 Scotturb 403 路公共汽车定期发车前往辛特拉 (Sintra)，在罗卡角停靠。 也可以到北部参观法蒂玛圣母院（圣地），它是举世闻名的圣母玛丽亚显现之地。
mt: To the north, it's easy to reach the romantic town of Sintra, which was praised by Lord Byron and is thus well known to foreigners. The Scotturb 403 bus runs regularly to Sintra, stopping at Rocha. You can also visit the Fatima Sanctuary in the north, which is the site of the Virgin Mary's apparition.
ref: To the north and within easy reach is the romantic and fascinating town of Sintra and which was made famous to foreigners after a glowing account of its splendours recorded by Lord Byron. Scotturb Bus 403 travels regularly to Sintra, stopping at Cabo da Roca. Also to the north visit the great Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fatima (Shrine), a place of worldwide famous Marian apparitions.

src: 1994 年，阿塞拜疆的亚美尼亚族纳戈尔诺—卡拉巴赫地区向阿塞拜疆人发动了战争。 在亚美尼亚的支持下，一个新共和国诞生了。然而，它没有得到任何国家（包括亚美尼亚）的正式承认。 该地区的外交纷争，继续导致亚美尼亚和阿塞拜疆之间的关系恶化。
mt: 1994 saw the Nagorno-Karabakh region of Azerbaijan, populated by Armenians, launch a war against the Azeris. A new republic was born with the support of Armenia, but it was not formally recognized by any country (including Armenia). The diplomatic wrangling over the region continues to worsen relations between Armenia and Azerbaijan.
ref: In 1994, the ethnically Armenian Nagorno-Karabakh region of Azerbaijan waged war against the Azeris. With Armenian backing, a new republic was created. However, no established nation - not even Armenia - officially recognizes it. Diplomatic arguments over the region continue to mar relations between Armenia and Azerbaijan.

src: 北卡罗来纳州夏洛特市的优势之一在于它为家庭提供了许多高质量的选择。 来自其他地区的住户常常评赞，家庭友好是他们移居那里的主要原因，而游客们也会发现带着孩子一起游览这座城市非常惬意。 过去 20 年来，夏洛特上城区方便儿童的设施实现了指数级增长。 在夏洛特 (Charlotte) 生活的家庭除了特殊情况外，一般不使用出租车。 乘客超过 2 人则需要额外付费，所以这个选项可能比较昂贵，没有必要。
mt: One of the advantages of living in Charlotte, North Carolina, is the many high-quality options it offers families. Residents from other areas often praise the family-friendly nature of the city as the main reason they moved there, and visitors will find that touring the city with children is very pleasant. Over the past 20 years, the uptown area of Charlotte has seen an exponential growth in family-friendly facilities. Families living in Charlotte generally do not use taxis, except in special cases. Additional fees are charged for passengers over two, so this option may be expensive and unnecessary.
ref: One of strong points of Charlotte, North Carolina, is that it has an abundance of high-quality options for families. Residents from other areas often cite family-friendliness as a primary reason for moving there, and visitors often find the city easy to enjoy with children around. In the past 20 years, the amount of child-friendly options in Uptown Charlotte has grown exponentially. Taxis are not generally used by families in Charlotte, though they can be of some use in certain circumstances. There is a surcharge for having more than 2 passengers, so this option might be more expensive than necessary.

src: 在 16 世纪西班牙人到来之前，智利北部受印加统治，而土著阿拉可尼人（Araucanians）（即马普切人）则居住于智利中部和南部。 马普切人也是最后独立的美洲原住民部落之一。直到智利独立后，才完全归入西班牙语系统治者的统治下。 尽管智利在1810年宣布独立（在拿破仑战争期间，西班牙在数年中没有正常运作的中央政府），但直到1818年才取得对西班牙的决定性胜利。
mt: 16th century Spanish arrival in Chile, the north was under Inca rule, while the indigenous Araucanians (Araucanians) lived in central and southern Chile. The Araucanians were also one of the last independent American tribes. Only after Chile's independence did it completely enter the Spanish language system under the rule of the central government. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (during the Napoleonic Wars, Spain had no normal functioning central government for several years), it was not until 1818 that it won decisively over Spain.
ref: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile. The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.

src: 五渔村（Cinque Terre），原意为五块土地，由位于意大利利古里亚（Liguria）地区的五座沿海小村庄 Riomaggiore、Manarola、Corniglia、Vernazza 和 Monterosso 组成。 它们被列入了联合国教科文组织世界遗产名录。 几个世纪以来，人们在崎岖陡峭的地形上精心建造梯田，这些山坡一直延伸到俯瞰大海的悬崖峭壁。 它的魅力部分在于没有明显的企业发展。村庄靠道路、火车和船只连接起来，开车无法从外面到达这些村庄。
mt: 5 Villages (Cinque Terre), literally meaning 5 lands, are five villages in the Italian region of Liguria: Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso. They are listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. For centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the steep slopes, which extend to the cliffs overlooking the sea. Its charm is partly due to the lack of obvious business development. The villages are connected by roads, trains and boats, and cars cannot reach these villages from outside.
ref: Cinque Terre, which means Five Lands, comprises the five small coastal villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso located in the Italian region of Liguria. They are listed on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea. Part of its charm is the lack of visible corporate development. Paths, trains and boats connect the villages, and cars cannot reach them from the outside.

src: 冬天最常见的事故原因是道路和路面（人行道）湿滑，特别是台阶。 至少你需要鞋底适当的鞋子。穿夏季鞋在冰雪上行走通常很滑，甚至一些冬季靴也有所不足。 鞋纹应该足够深，在5 毫米（1/5英寸）或以上；材料应在低温下足够柔软。 有的靴子有鞋钉；也有为湿滑路面设计的、带有鞋钉的扩展装备，适用于大多数鞋子和靴子，能装在鞋跟上，或同时装在鞋跟和鞋底上。 鞋跟应该低而宽。道路上经常会撒上细沙、砂石或盐粒（氯化钙），以增加摩擦力。
mt: 1. The most common cause of winter accidents is slippery roads and sidewalks, especially stairs. At least you need appropriate shoes. Walking on ice in summer shoes is usually slippery, and even some winter boots are not enough. The tread should be deep enough, at least 5 millimeters (1/5 inch) or more; the material should be soft enough at low temperatures. Some boots have cleats; there are also extension equipment designed for slippery roads, with cleats that fit most shoes and boots, which can be mounted on the heel or simultaneously on the heel and sole. The heel should be low and wide. Roads are often sprinkled with fine sand, gravel or salt grains (calcium chloride), to increase friction.
ref: The most common cause for accidents in winter is slippery roads, pavements (sidewalks) and especially steps. At a minimum, you need footwear with suitable soles. Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow, even some winter boots are deficient. The pattern should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inch) or more, and the material soft enough in cold temperatures. Some boots have studs and there is studded add-on equipment for slippery conditions, suitable for most shoes and boots, for the heels or heels and sole. Heels should be low and wide. Sand, gravel or salt (calcium chloride) is often scattered on roads or paths to improve traction.

src: 库克群岛是一个岛国，是新西兰的自由结合区，位于南太平洋中部的波利尼西亚。 它是一个由 15 个岛屿组成的群岛，分布在 220 万平方公里的海面上。 由于和夏威夷处于同一时区，这些岛屿有时被认为是“南方的夏威夷”。 虽然规模较小，但它让一些年长的游客联想到建州之前的夏威夷，当时还没有这么多大型观光酒店和其他开发项目。 库克群岛没有城市，而是由 15 个不同的岛屿组成。主要的岛屿有拉罗汤加岛 (Rarotonga) 和艾图塔基岛 (Aitutaki)。
mt: The Cook Islands is a country in the South Pacific, a self-governing associated state of New Zealand. It is a collection of 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million square kilometres of ocean. Because it is in the same time zone as Hawaii, these islands are sometimes referred to as "Hawaii's southern cousins". Although smaller in scale, they remind some older tourists of Hawaii before the large resort hotels and other development projects. The Cook Islands have no cities, but are made up of 15 different islands. The main islands are Rarotonga and Aitutaki.
ref: "The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean. It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean. With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as ""Hawaii down under"". Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development. The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki."

src: 许可证必须提前预约。你必须持有许可证，才能在塞利纳过夜。 塞丽娜（Sirena）是唯一一个除露营之外还提供宿舍住宿和热餐的护林站。La Leona、San Pedrillo 和 Los Patos 只提供露营，不提供餐饮服务。 可以直接从希门尼斯港 (Puerto Jiménez) 的公园管理处获得入园许可，但不能使用信用卡 公园管理局只发出预计到访日期之前一个月以内的公园许可证。 CafeNet El Sol 提供预约服务，收费 30 美元，而一日通票价格为 10 美元；详情请见其 Corcovado 页面。
mt: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight in Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory accommodation and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo and Los Patos only offer camping and no meals. Permits can be obtained directly from the park office in Puerto Jiménez, but they cannot be paid for with credit cards. The park office only issues permits for dates up to one month in advance. CafeNet El Sol offers reservation services for a fee of $30, while the park permit costs $10; see their Corcovado page for details.
ref: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service. It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival. CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.

src: 滑雪自由行：这项活动也叫越野滑雪、滑雪旅游或滑雪远足。 这项活动与阿尔卑斯式滑雪旅行或登山运动相关，但通常不会进行这两项活动。这两项活动要在陡峭的地形上进行，而且需要更硬的滑雪板和靴子。 把滑雪路线想象成类似的徒步路线。 条件良好的时候，你可以比步行走得更远——但只有在极少数情况下，你才能获得与不背着沉重背包、在平整的轨道上越野滑雪相同的速度。
mt: Backcountry skiing: This activity is also called cross-country skiing, ski touring, or ski mountaineering. It is related to alpine ski touring and mountaineering, but usually does not involve these activities. These activities require steeper terrain and stiffer skis and boots. Imagine ski routes as similar to hiking trails. In good conditions, you can go farther than you can hike, but only in a few cases can you get the same speed as cross-country skiing on a smooth track without carrying a heavy backpack.
ref: Backpacking by ski: This activity is also called backcountry ski, ski touring or ski hiking. It is related to but usually not involving alpine style ski touring or mountaineering, the latter ones done in steep terrain and requiring much stiffer skis and boots. Think of the skiing route as of a similar hiking route. In good conditions you will be able to cover somewhat greater distances than walking – but only very seldom you will get the speeds of cross country skiing without a heavy backpack in groomed tracks.

mt: Backcountry skiing: This activity is also called cross-country skiing, ski touring, or ski mountaineering. It is related to alpine ski touring and mountaineering, but usually does not involve these activities. These activities require steeper terrain and stiffer skis and boots. Imagine ski routes as similar to hiking trails. In good conditions, you can go farther than you can hike, but only in a few cases can you get the same speed as cross-country skiing on a smooth track without carrying a heavy backpack.
ref: Backpacking by ski: This activity is also called backcountry ski, ski touring or ski hiking. It is related to but usually not involving alpine style ski touring or mountaineering, the latter ones done in steep terrain and requiring much stiffer skis and boots. Think of the skiing route as of a similar hiking route. In good conditions you will be able to cover somewhat greater distances than walking – but only very seldom you will get the speeds of cross country skiing without a heavy backpack in groomed tracks.

src: 重返家园的冲击比文化冲击来得更快（蜜月期更短），持续时间更长，也可能更严重。 对于很容易适应新文化的旅行者来说，有时很难重新适应他们的本土文化。 在国外生活了一段时间后回国，你会发现自己已经适应了新的文化，丢掉了一些家乡文化的习惯。 当你刚出国时，人们可能会很有耐心，很体谅你，因为他们知道旅行者来到新国家需要适应。 人们可能想不到，旅行者在回程中也需要耐心和理解。
mt: The shock of re-entry is faster than the culture shock (honeymoon period shorter), longer lasting, and possibly more severe. For travelers who are easily adaptable to new cultures, it can be difficult to re-adapt to their native culture. After living abroad for a while, you will find that you have adapted to the new culture and lost some of the habits of your native culture. When you first go abroad, people may be very patient and understanding with you, because they know that travelers coming to a new country need to adapt. People may not realize that travelers also need patience and understanding on the way back.
ref: Re-entry shock comes on sooner than culture shock (there's less of a honeymoon phase), lasts longer, and can be more severe. Travellers who had an easy time adjusting to the new culture sometimes have a particularly hard time readjusting to their native culture. When returning home after living abroad, you've adapted to the new culture and lost some of your habits from your home culture. When you went abroad at first, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travellers in a new country need to adapt. People may not anticipate that patience and understanding are also necessary for travellers returning home.

src: 驼鹿（也被称为麋鹿）天生不具攻击性，但如果感觉到威胁它们也会自卫。 有些人不把驼鹿当成潜在的危险，可能会靠得太近，将自己置于危险之中。
mt: Reindeer are naturally not aggressive, but they will defend themselves if they feel threatened. Some people don't consider reindeer to be a potential danger and may get too close, putting themselves in danger.
ref: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat. When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.

src: 在白天最热的时候，旅行者们可以体验到由水（或其他东西）所形成的错觉——海市蜃楼。 旅行者追逐海市蜃楼会十分危险，因为会浪费宝贵的精力和剩余的水。 即使是最炎热的沙漠，夜间也会变得极其寒冷。如果没有保暖的衣服，低体温症是真实存在的风险。
mt: During the hottest part of the day, travelers can experience mirages formed by water (or other things). Travelers chasing mirages are dangerous because they waste precious energy and remaining water. Even the hottest deserts become extremely cold at night. Without warm clothing, hypothermia is a real risk.
ref: In the heat of the day, travelers can experience mirages that give the illusion of water (or other things). These can be dangerous if the traveler pursue the mirage, wasting precious energy and remaining water. Even the hottest of deserts can become extremely cold at night. Hypothermia is a real risk without warm clothing.

src: 多米尼加共和国（西班牙语：República Dominicana）是一个加勒比国家，地处伊斯帕尼奥拉岛的东半部分，该岛分属多米尼加与海地两国 除了拥有白色沙滩和山地景观，该国还是美洲地区最古老的欧洲风格城市的所在地，如今成为了圣多明各的其中一部分。 泰诺人 (Taínos) 和加勒比人 (Caribes) 最先来到这个岛上定居。加勒比人是讲阿拉瓦克语 (Arawakan) 的民族，大约于公元前 10000 年来到这里。 在欧洲探险者到来后的短短几年里，西班牙征服者就大大削减了泰诺斯的人口 根据《Fray Bartolomé de las Casas》（Tratado de las Indias），1492 年至 1498 年间，西班牙侵略者杀害了约 100,000 台诺人。
mt: The Dominican Republic is a Caribbean nation located on the eastern two-thirds of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti. In addition to its white-sand beaches and mountainous landscape, the country is also home to some of the oldest European-style cities in the Americas, which are now part of Santo Domingo. The Taíno and Carib people were the first to settle on the island. The Caribs were an Arawakan-speaking people who arrived around 4000 BC. In the short time between the arrival of European explorers, Spanish conquistadors greatly reduced the Taíno population. According to Fray Bartolomé de las Casas, between 1492 and 1498, Spanish invaders killed approximately 100,000 Taínos.
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: 高山滑雪运动包括普通滑雪和雪板滑雪，是非常受欢迎的运动，在这项运动中，滑雪板或滑雪单板会固定在您的双脚上，从白雪覆盖的地形上滑下来。 滑雪是许多滑雪爱好者的主要旅游活动，这些爱好者有时也被称为“滑雪狂人”，他们计划整个假期都在某个地点滑雪。 滑雪这个想法由来已久——绘有滑雪者的洞穴壁画，年份可以追溯到公元前 5000 年！ 作为一项运动，高山滑雪至少可以追溯到 17 世纪，1861年，挪威人在澳大利亚开设了第一家休闲滑雪俱乐部。
mt: Alpine skiing includes both downhill skiing and snowboarding, and is a very popular sport in which skis or snowboards are attached to your feet and you slide down from the terrain covered in snow. Skiing is the main tourist activity for many skiing enthusiasts, who are sometimes called "ski bums," who plan their entire vacation at one location to ski. The idea of skiing has been around for a long time — cave paintings depicting skiers date back to 5000 BC! As a sport, alpine skiing can be traced back to the 17th century, and in 1861, Norwegians opened the first recreational ski club in Australia.
ref: "Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. Skiing is a major travelling activity with many enthusiasts, occasionally known as ""ski bums,"" planning entire vacations around skiing at a particular location. The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! Downhill skiing as a sport goes back to at least the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club was opened by Norwegians in Australia."

src: 东非岛屿位于非洲东海岸外的印度洋上。 马达加斯加是目前为止最大的岛屿，对野生动物来说还是一片独立的大陆。 较小的岛屿大多是独立国家，或所属于法国，它们以豪华海滩度假胜地而闻名。 阿拉伯人也把伊斯兰教带到了这片土地，这一教义在科摩罗和马约特国家盛行。 欧洲的影响和殖民主义始于15世纪，当时葡萄牙探险家瓦斯科·达·伽马（Vasco da Gama）发现了从欧洲到印度的开普敦航线。
mt: The islands of East Africa lie off the east coast of Africa in the Indian Ocean. Madagascar is the largest island so far, and is a large independent continent for wild animals. Smaller islands are mostly independent countries or belong to France, and are known for their luxurious beach resorts. Arab influence and Islam came to this land, and this religion is prevalent in the Comoros and Mayotte countries. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, when Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovered the Cape of Good Hope route from Europe to India.
ref: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife. Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts. The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.

src: 有个传统是在复活节之夜在户外某处醒着看日出。 当然，这个传统有其基督教神学的解释，但它很可能是基督诞生以前就存在的一种庆祝春天、祈求丰收的仪式。 更传统的教堂常常在复活节周末的周六晚上举行复活节守夜活动，会众通常在午夜钟声敲响之时涌入庆典，庆祝基督的复活。
mt: There is a tradition of staying up all night on Easter Sunday to watch the sunrise. Of course, this tradition has its Christian theological explanation, but it is likely that this was a celebration of spring and a prayer for a bountiful harvest that existed before the birth of Christ. More traditional churches often hold Easter vigil services on the Saturday night of Easter weekend, and the congregation usually rushes into the celebration at midnight when the clock strikes, celebrating the resurrection of Christ.
ref: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise. There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual. More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

src: 厄瓜多尔规定：古巴公民必须在收到邀请函后，才能通过国际机场或边境口岸进入厄瓜多尔。 该函必须经厄瓜多尔外交部批准，并符合某些要求。 这些要求是为了在两国之间实现有条不紊的移居而设计的。 持有美国绿卡的古巴公民应访问厄瓜多尔领事馆获得对此要求的豁免。 你的护照离出发日期应至少有 6 个月，而且需要一张往返/联程机票来证明你的停留时间。
mt: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens must be invited to enter Ecuador through international airports or border crossings. The invitation must be approved by the Ecuadorian Foreign Ministry and meet certain requirements. These requirements are designed to facilitate orderly migration between the two countries. Cuban citizens with a green card in the United States should visit the Ecuadorian consulate to obtain an exemption from these requirements. Your passport should have at least 6 months validity before departure and a round-trip/through ticket to prove your stay.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points. This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: 眼镜在国外可能更便宜，特别是在低收入国家，那里的劳动力成本更加低廉。 可以考虑在本国做眼部检查（尤其是医保可以报销的情况下），然后将处方拿到其他地方去配镜。 在这些地区买到的高端品牌镜架可能存在两个问题：有些可能是山寨货，而且正品进口镜架可能比在国内购买要贵。
mt: Eyeglasses may be cheaper abroad, especially in low-income countries, where labor costs are lower. Consider having an eye exam in your home country (especially if it is covered by insurance), and then taking the prescription to another country to get the glasses. High-end brand frames purchased in these areas may have two problems: some may be counterfeit, and genuine imported frames may be more expensive than buying them in your home country.
ref: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower. Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere. High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.

src: 福克兰群岛的官方货币是福克兰英镑，与英镑等值。 可以在岛上唯一的银行兑换货币，该银行位于斯坦利，在 FIC West 商店对面。 英镑一般在岛上所有地方都通用，斯坦利境内也往往可以用信用卡和美元付款。 在外围岛屿，可能无法使用信用卡，但可以使用英美货币；请事先与房主联系，确认可接受的付款方式。 几乎不可能在岛外兑换福克兰群岛的货币，所以要在离岛之前兑换。
mt: The official currency of the Falkland Islands is the Falkland pound, which is equal to the pound sterling. Currency can be exchanged at the only bank on the island, which is located in Stanley, across from FIC West store. Pounds are generally accepted everywhere on the island, and credit cards and dollars are often accepted in Stanley. Credit cards may not be accepted on the outer islands, but British and American currency is; please contact your host beforehand to confirm acceptable payment methods. It is unlikely that currency can be exchanged outside the islands, so currency should be exchanged before leaving.
ref: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store. British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted. On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method. It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.

src: 大多数寺庙都有一年一度的节日，从十一月底开始，到五月中旬结束，每个寺庙的节日时间各不相同。 大多数寺庙节日都是为了庆祝寺庙周年纪念日、主持神的生日等寺庙大事而举办的。 喀拉拉邦的寺庙节日极其有趣，通常有装饰华丽的大象游行、寺庙管弦乐队表演和其他庆典活动。
mt: Most temples have an annual festival, from late November to mid-May, with each temple's festival time different. Most temple festivals are held to celebrate temple anniversaries, birthdays of the presiding deities, and other temple events. Temple festivals in Kerala are particularly interesting, usually featuring decorated elephants in parades, temple orchestras, and other ceremonial activities.
ref: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar. Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple. Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.

src: 乘坐头等舱或商务舱最明显的方式是花一大笔钱来享受这种特权（或者，更好的方式是让你的公司给你出钱乘坐）。 然而，这并不便宜：根据粗略估算，商务舱的票价可能是普通经济舱的 4 倍，头等舱的票价更是 11 倍之高！ 一般来说，从 A 地直飞 B 地，压根没必要去找商务舱或头等舱的打折机票。 航空公司非常清楚，有一些核心乘客愿花高价获得快速、舒适出行的特权，因此航空公司会相应地收取费用。
mt: 1. The most obvious way to sit in first or business class is to spend a lot of money to enjoy this privilege (or, better yet, to let your company pay for you to sit in business class). However, this is not cheap: according to a rough estimate, the price of a business class ticket may be four times that of an economy class ticket, and the price of a first class ticket is even higher! Generally speaking, there is no need to look for discounted business class or first class tickets when flying directly from A to B. Airlines are very clear that some core passengers are willing to pay a high price to enjoy the privilege of fast and comfortable travel, so airlines will charge accordingly.
ref: The obvious way of flying in first or business class is to fork out a thick wad of money for the privilege (or, better yet, get your company to do it for you). However, this does not come cheap: as rough rules of thumb, you can expect to pay up to four times the normal economy fare for business, and eleven times for first class! Generally speaking, there is no point in even looking for discounts for business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know well that there is a certain core group of flyers who are willing to pay top dollar for the privilege of getting somewhere fast and in comfort, and charge accordingly.

src: 诸如阿联酋航空公司、阿提哈德航空公司、卡塔尔航空公司和土耳其航空公司之类的航司已经大大扩展了对非洲的服务业务，提供了飞往非洲许多主要城市的航线，价格也比其他欧洲航空公司更有竞争力。 从 2014 年开始，土耳其航空公司可到达 30 个非洲国家的 39 个目的地。 如果你的旅行时间有富余，请查看前往非洲的总票价跟环球旅行票价的比较情况。 对于非洲以外的所有地区，别忘了加上额外的签证费、离境税、地面交通等费用。
mt: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad, Qatar Airways, and Turkish Airlines have expanded their services to Africa, offering routes to many major cities on the continent at competitive prices compared to other European airlines. Turkish Airlines, for example, began service to 39 destinations in 30 African countries in 2014. If you have extra time, check out the total ticket prices for trips to Africa compared to around-the-world tickets. For all regions outside of Africa, don't forget to add in additional visa fees, departure taxes, and ground transportation.
ref: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways & Turkish Airlines have greatly expanded their services to Africa, and offer connections to many major African cities at competitive rates than other European airlines. Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries as of 2014. If you have additional travel time, check to see how your total fare quote to Africa compares with a round-the-world fare. Don't forget to add in the extra costs of additional visas, departure taxes, ground transportation, etc. for all those places outside of Africa.

src: 在超市购买食物通常是填饱肚子最便宜的方式。如果不具备烹饪条件，就只能选择现成的食物。 超市里成品食品的种类越来越多。有些甚至提供微波炉或其他方法用来加热食品。 在某些国家或某些类型的商店，至少有一家餐厅（通常是非正式的）的价格相当实惠。
mt: 1. Buying food at the supermarket is often the cheapest way to fill your stomach. If you don't have cooking facilities, you can only choose ready-made food. 2. The variety of ready-made food in supermarkets is increasing. Some even provide microwaves or other methods to heat the food. 3. In some countries or some types of stores, at least one restaurant (usually informal) is affordable.
ref: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food. Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food. In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.

src: 比利时和瑞士使用的法语语种与法国使用的法语尽管非常相似，可以互通，但还是稍有不同。 具体说来，比利时和瑞士讲的法语在数字系统上有一些细微的特殊性，与法国讲的法语不同，一些单词的发音也略有不同。 不过，所有说法语的比利时人和瑞士人都会在学校里学习标准法语，所以即使您使用标准的法国度量系统，他们也能听得懂。
mt: Although the French spoken in Belgium and Switzerland is very similar to the French spoken in France, there are some differences. In particular, the French spoken in Belgium and Switzerland has some minor differences in its number system, and some words are pronounced differently. However, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss will learn standard French in school, so even if you use the standard French measurement system, they will understand you.
ref: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. In particular, the numbering system in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland has some slight peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of some words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

src: 只有少数几家航空公司扔提供丧亲票价，这比为赶赴葬礼的临时出行稍微便宜一些。 提供此类票价的航空公司包括加拿大航空公司、达美航空公司、德国汉莎航空公司（从美国或加拿大起飞的航班）以及西捷航空公司。 无论情况如何，你都必须直接打电话向航空公司订票。
mt: Only a few airlines offer bereavement fares, which are slightly cheaper than last-minute travel for a funeral. Airlines that offer this include Air Canada, Delta, Lufthansa (from the U.S. or Canada) and WestJet. Regardless of the situation, you must call the airline directly to book.
ref: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly discount the cost of last-minute funeral travel. Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

ref: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly discount the cost of last-minute funeral travel. Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

src: 出国旅行时，使用智能手机 GPS 导航应用可能是最简单方便的导航方式。 比起够买带 GPS 的地图或独立的 GPS 设备，或者是从汽车租赁公司租一个，这种方式更省钱。 如果你的手机没有数据连接，或者不在服务范围，手机的性能可能会受限，或者无法使用手机。
mt: Using a GPS navigation app on your smartphone is the simplest and most convenient way to navigate when traveling abroad. It's cheaper than buying a map with GPS or a standalone GPS device, or renting one from a car rental company. If your phone doesn't have data connectivity or is out of range, your phone's performance may be limited or you may not be able to use your phone.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: 要游览加拉帕戈斯群岛的景点和野生动植物，最好的交通方式就是乘船。查尔斯·达尔文在 1835 年就是乘船游览此地的。 超过 60 艘游船在加拉帕戈斯群岛（Galapagos）水域定期往返——这些游船的体量从可承载 8 人到 100 人不等。 多数人很早就提前订好位置（因为船在旺季通常会客满）。 一定要确保你预订行程的代理是一位对各种船只拥有丰富知识的加拉帕戈斯群岛（Galapagos）专家。 这能确保你的某项兴趣和/或约束条件能与最适合他们的船只相互匹配。
mt: The best way to see the sights and wildlife of the Galapagos Islands is by boat. Charles Darwin visited the islands by boat in 1835. More than 60 boats ply the waters of the Galapagos Islands, ranging in size from eight to 100 passengers. Most people book early (as boats are often full in high season). Make sure your agent is an expert on all the boats in the Galapagos Islands, so that your interests and/or constraints can be matched with the most suitable boat.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835. Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships. This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: 赌场一般会想方设法让客人花费尽量多的时间和金钱。赌场通常没有窗户和时钟，出口也很难找到。 他们通常会提供特别的食品、饮料和娱乐活动，让客人保持愉悦，留在赌场。 有些场地免费提供酒精饮料。然而，醉酒会削弱人的判断能力，所有优秀的赌徒都知道保持清醒的重要性。
mt: Casinos generally try to keep customers spending as much time and money as possible. Casinos usually have no windows or clocks, and exits are often hard to find. They often provide special food, drinks, and entertainment to keep customers happy and in the casino. Some establishments offer free alcohol. However, intoxication weakens judgment, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
ref: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find. They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise. Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.

src: 除去表示您的“Sie”之外的所有名词都应以大写字母开头，即使在句子中间也应如此。 这是区分某些动词和宾语的一个重要方法。 这也可以让阅读更轻松，尽管这在一定程度上使书写变得复杂，因为你需要判断动词或形容词是否被用作一种名词化的形式。
mt: 除去表示您的“Sie”之外的所有名词都应以大写字母开头，即使在句子中间也应如此。 这是区分某些动词和宾语的一个重要方法。 这也可以让阅读更轻松，尽管这在一定程度上使书写变得复杂，因为你需要判断动词或形容词是否被用作一种名词化的形式。
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

src: 除去表示您的“Sie”之外的所有名词都应以大写字母开头，即使在句子中间也应如此。 这是区分某些动词和宾语的一个重要方法。 这也可以让阅读更轻松，尽管这在一定程度上使书写变得复杂，因为你需要判断动词或形容词是否被用作一种名词化的形式。
mt: 除去表示您的“Sie”之外的所有名词都应以大写字母开头，即使在句子中间也应如此。 这是区分某些动词和宾语的一个重要方法。 这也可以让阅读更轻松，尽管这在一定程度上使书写变得复杂，因为你需要判断动词或形容词是否被用作一种名词化的形式。
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

src: 在世界上许多地方，挥手是一种友好的表示，意思是“你好”。 但是，在马来西亚，至少在农村地区的马来人中，这个手势类似于在某些西方国家用食指朝自己身体摆动，表示“过来”，并且这个手势仅用来表示这个意思。 同样，挥手告别时，如果掌心向着挥手者自己（而不是向着要挥别的人），身处西班牙的英国游客可能会误以为这是请人回来的手势。
mt: In many parts of the world, a wave is a friendly gesture, meaning "hello." But in Malaysia, at least in rural areas among the Malays, this gesture is similar to the Western gesture of pointing a finger at oneself, meaning "come here," and this gesture is only used to mean this. Similarly, when waving goodbye, if the palm is facing the waver himself (rather than facing the person being waved away), a British tourist in Spain might mistake this for an invitation to come back.
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: 在世界上许多地方，挥手是一种友好的表示，意思是“你好”。 但是，在马来西亚，至少在农村地区的马来人中，这个手势类似于在某些西方国家用食指朝自己身体摆动，表示“过来”，并且这个手势仅用来表示这个意思。 同样，挥手告别时，如果掌心向着挥手者自己（而不是向着要挥别的人），身处西班牙的英国游客可能会误以为这是请人回来的手势。
mt: In many parts of the world, a wave is a friendly gesture, meaning "hello." But in Malaysia, at least in rural areas among the Malays, this gesture is similar to the Western gesture of pointing a finger at oneself, meaning "come here," and this gesture is only used to mean this. Similarly, when waving goodbye, if the palm is facing the waver himself (rather than facing the person being waved away), a British tourist in Spain might mistake this for an invitation to come back.
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: 冰川并不是稳定的，而会从山上流下来。这会导致出现裂缝和冰裂隙，而这些裂隙可能会被雪桥掩盖。 冰洞的墙壁和屋顶可能会坍塌，裂缝可能会闭合。 在冰川的边缘，巨大的冰块会松动、掉落，也许还会跳到或滚到离边缘更远的地方。
mt: Glaciers are not stable, and they flow down from the mountains. This can cause crevasses and ice cliffs to appear, which may be covered by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves may collapse, and crevasses may close. At the edges of glaciers, large ice blocks may loosen, fall, and perhaps jump or roll farther away from the edge.
ref: The glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause cracks, crevasses, which may be obscured by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: 戈马是刚果民主共和国的一个旅游城市，位于刚果的最东边，靠近卢旺达。 2002 年，戈马被尼拉贡戈火山的熔岩所摧毁。火山熔岩掩埋了该镇的大部分街道，尤其是镇中心。 尽管戈马还算安全，但前往戈马以外的任何地方都应该事先调查，以便了解北基伍省持续的战斗有没有缓和。 这座城市也是攀登尼拉贡戈火山（Nyiragongo）以及非洲最便宜的山地大猩猩追踪项目的基地。 你可以乘坐 boda-boda（出租的摩托车）游览戈马（Goma）。短途车程的正常（当地）价格是 500 刚果法郎。
mt: Goma is a tourist city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, located at the eastern end of the country, near Rwanda. In 2002, Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano. Lava from the volcano buried most of the town's streets, especially in the town center. Although Goma is relatively safe, any travel outside of Goma should be investigated beforehand to see if the ongoing fighting in North Kivu has abated. The city is also the base for climbing the Nyiragongo volcano and the cheapest mountain gorilla tracking project in Africa. You can tour Goma by boda-boda (motorcycle taxi). The normal (local) price for a short trip is 500 Congolese francs.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda. In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre. While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: 需要获得野营许可证才可以在大峡谷边缘的下方露营。 为了保护大峡谷，许可证限量发放。按启程月份算起提前四个月，在该月的第一天开始发放。 因此，如果启程日期为 5 月，野地露营许可证将在 1 月 1 日发放。 最受欢迎的区域比如幽灵牧场 (Phantom Ranch) 附近的光明天使 (Bright Angel) 露营地，通常在第一天开放预订时就会收到满额预订申请。 对于未经预约的到访，许可证的预留数量有限，并按先到先得的原则提供许可证。
mt: You need a permit to camp below the rim of the Grand Canyon. Permits are limited to protect the canyon. Permits are released four months in advance, starting on the first day of the month in which you plan to start your trip. So if you plan to start in May, permits will be released on January 1. The most popular areas like Phantom Ranch near Bright Angel Campground are usually booked up by the first day of permit release. For unreserved visits, permits are limited and provided on a first-come, first-served basis.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.
