src: 有些酒店的渊源可以追溯到蒸汽火车和远洋轮船的黄金时代：第二次世界大战之前，在 19 世纪或 20 世纪初。 这些酒店是当时富人和名人的落脚处，并且通常有高档餐厅和夜生活场所。 传统装备、缺乏最新设施及颇具年代感的优雅韵味也是其特色。 虽然它们通常是属于私人所有的，但有时也为来访的国家元首和其他政要提供住宿。 一名腰缠万贯的旅客可能会考虑乘飞机环游世界，并在旅途中陆续入住许多家这样的酒店。
mt: Some hotels can trace their origins back to the golden age of steam trains and ocean liners: before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th century. These hotels were the places where the rich and famous of the time stayed, and usually had fine dining and nightlife facilities. Traditional fittings, lack of modern facilities and a certain air of elegance are also features. Although they are usually privately owned, they sometimes provide accommodation for visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A wealthy traveller might consider flying around the world and staying in many of these hotels along the way.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries. These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife. The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character. While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: 多亏有了与欧洲相连的海底光缆和宽带卫星，格陵兰网络连接畅通，93% 的人口接入了互联网。 你的酒店或房东（如果住在民宿或私人民宅）可能配有 wifi 或可联网的电脑。所有安置点都有一家网吧或有公共 wifi 的地方。 正如上文所提，虽然“爱斯基摩人”这个词在美国仍然可以接受，但北极地区的许多非美籍人士，尤其是对加拿大人来说，他们都认为这个词带有贬义含义。 尽管你可能会听到格陵兰本地人用这个词，但外国人应该避免使用。 在加拿大，格陵兰岛的土著居民称自己为因纽特人，在格陵兰岛则称自己为 Kalaalleq（复数为 Kalaallit），也就是“格陵兰人”的意思。 在格陵兰岛，针对外国人的犯罪和恶意行为总体来说几乎闻所未闻。即使在城镇里，也没有 “犯罪高发区”。 严寒也许是没有准备的人将面临的唯一真正的危险。 如果你在寒冷的季节到访格陵兰岛（记住越往北走越冷），一定要带够保暖衣物。 夏季漫长的白昼会导致睡眠不足和相关健康问题。 在夏季，也要注意北欧的蚊子。虽然这些蚊子不会传播任何疾病，但它们可能会让人感到不适。
mt: Thanks to undersea fiber-optic cables and broadband satellites connected to Europe, Greenland has a robust Internet connection, with 93% of the population online. Your hotel or host (if you’re staying in a bed and breakfast or private home) may have Wi-Fi or a computer with Internet access. All settlements have an Internet cafe or a place with public Wi-Fi. As mentioned above, while the term “Eskimo” is still acceptable in the United States, many non-Americans, especially Canadians, consider the word to be derogatory. Although you may hear Greenlandic locals use the term, foreigners should avoid using it. In Canada, the indigenous people of Greenland are called Inuit, and in Greenland they call themselves Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), meaning “Greenlander.” Crime and malicious acts against foreigners are almost unheard of in Greenland, even in the towns. The only real danger you may face is the cold, which may be a problem for those who are unprepared. If you visit Greenland in the cold season (remember, the further north you go, the colder it gets), be sure to bring adequate warm clothing. The long summer days will cause sleep deprivation and related health problems. In the summer, also be aware of the mosquitoes of the north. While these mosquitoes do not carry any diseases, they may make you uncomfortable.
ref: "Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access. Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. As mentioned above, though the word ""Eskimo"" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada. While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland. Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no ""rough areas."" Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues. During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating."

src: 联盟花园 (Jardín de la Unión)。这里曾是一座 17 世纪修道院的中庭，其中的圣地亚哥圣殿是唯一现存的建筑。 现在这里成为了中心广场，昼夜都热闹繁忙。 花园周围有许多餐馆，在下午和晚上，中央凉亭经常会有免费演唱会。 Callejon del Beso（亲吻小巷）。两个相隔仅 69 厘米的阳台是一个古老的爱情传说发生的地方。 只要给一点点钱，你就能让一些孩子讲这个故事。
mt: 17th century cloister courtyard, where the only remaining building, the Santiago de Compostela church, is located. It is now a central square, busy day and night. Around the garden are many restaurants, and in the afternoon and evening, the central pavilion is often free concerts. Callejon del Beso (kiss alley). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is where an old love story happened. For a small fee, some children can tell you the story.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: 联盟花园 (Jardín de la Unión)。这里曾是一座 17 世纪修道院的中庭，其中的圣地亚哥圣殿是唯一现存的建筑。 现在这里成为了中心广场，昼夜都热闹繁忙。 花园周围有许多餐馆，在下午和晚上，中央凉亭经常会有免费演唱会。 Callejon del Beso（亲吻小巷）。两个相隔仅 69 厘米的阳台是一个古老的爱情传说发生的地方。 只要给一点点钱，你就能让一些孩子讲这个故事。
mt: 17th century cloister courtyard, where the only remaining building, the Santiago de Compostela church, is located. It is now a central square, busy day and night. Around the garden are many restaurants, and in the afternoon and evening, the central pavilion is often free concerts. Callejon del Beso (kiss alley). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is where an old love story happened. For a small fee, some children can tell you the story.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: 远足是指在自然环境中（通常是在远足步道上）行走的户外活动。 单日徒步是指一天内走完的行程，行程距离可低至少于一英里。 沿着一条平缓的小径远足一天几乎不需要什么准备，并且任何人只要身体不算差，都可以享受远足的乐趣。 有小孩的家庭可能需要做更多的准备，但即使带着婴儿和学龄前儿童，在户外待一天也不难。
mt: Hiking is a form of walking, usually done with the specific purpose of exploring the outdoors. Day hiking is hiking done in a single day, with a distance of at least one mile. Hiking a day along a gentle trail requires little preparation and can be enjoyed by anyone with a reasonably healthy body. Families with young children may need to do more preparation, but even with infants and preschoolers, a day outdoors is not difficult.
ref: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails. Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day. For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them. Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.

For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them. Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.

src: 挪威的典型地貌，是陡峭的峡湾和山谷突然变成了高大的、多多少少无甚起伏的高原。 这些高原通常被称为 “vidde”，意思是广阔的、开放的、没有树木的空间，是一片浩瀚无垠的区域。 在罗加兰和阿格德，它们被俗称为“hei”，意思是没有树木的荒野，通常长满石南。
mt: Norway's typical landscape is a sudden transition from steep fjords and valleys to high, more or less featureless plateaus. These plateaus are usually called "vidde", meaning a broad, open, treeless space, a vast expanse. In Rogaland and Agder, they are called "hei", meaning treeless wilderness, usually covered in heather.
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: 山中避暑之地的旅游旺季通常是在印度的夏季。 然而，冬天却另有一番不同的美景和魅力，许多山中避暑之地的雪量恰到好处。这些地方会提供活动项目，例如滑雪和滑板滑雪。
mt: The tourist season in the hills is usually during the Indian summer. However, there is a different beauty and charm in the winter, with many hill stations having just the right amount of snow. These places will offer activities such as skiing and snowboarding.
ref: The tourist season for the hill stations generally peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm during winter, with many hill stations receiving healthy amounts of snow and offering activities such as skiing and snowboarding.

src: 山中避暑之地的旅游旺季通常是在印度的夏季。 然而，冬天却另有一番不同的美景和魅力，许多山中避暑之地的雪量恰到好处。这些地方会提供活动项目，例如滑雪和滑板滑雪。
mt: The tourist season in the hills is usually during the Indian summer. However, there is a different beauty and charm in the winter, with many hill stations having just the right amount of snow. These places will offer activities such as skiing and snowboarding.
ref: The tourist season for the hill stations generally peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm during winter, with many hill stations receiving healthy amounts of snow and offering activities such as skiing and snowboarding.

src: 请放心，在到达码头后，一切都会顺其自然。你会遇到其他要搭便船的人，他们会与你分享信息。 基本上，你可以张贴告示，告知他人你可以提供帮助、在码头上来回走动、接触正在清理游艇的人或酒吧里的水手等等。 试着和尽可能多的人聊天。过一段时间，每个人都会认识你，他们会提示你哪条船在找人。
mt: Don't worry, once you get to the port, everything will fall into place. You will meet other people who are looking for a boat ride, and they will share information with you. Basically, you can post a notice, informing people that you can help, walk around the port, contact people who are cleaning up boats, or sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while, everyone will know you, and they will tell you which boat is looking for people.
ref: Be assured that once you hit the marinas everything will be pretty obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.

src: 请放心，在到达码头后，一切都会顺其自然。你会遇到其他要搭便船的人，他们会与你分享信息。 基本上，你可以张贴告示，告知他人你可以提供帮助、在码头上来回走动、接触正在清理游艇的人或酒吧里的水手等等。 试着和尽可能多的人聊天。过一段时间，每个人都会认识你，他们会提示你哪条船在找人。
mt: Don't worry, once you get to the port, everything will fall into place. You will meet other people who are looking for a boat ride, and they will share information with you. Basically, you can post a notice, informing people that you can help, walk around the port, contact people who are cleaning up boats, or sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while, everyone will know you, and they will tell you which boat is looking for people.
ref: Be assured that once you hit the marinas everything will be pretty obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.

src: 香港岛是香港地区的代名词，也是众多游客心目中的焦点所在。 构成香港天际线的众多建筑就像是一幅闪闪发光的条形图，在维多利亚港水域的映衬下显得格外醒目。 若想从最佳角度欣赏香港的美景，可以离开该岛，前往对面的九龙海滨。 香港岛大部分的城市发展都集中在北岸的填海土地上。 这里是英国殖民者占领的地方，所以如果你想寻找这片领土殖民历史的证据，这里是一个很好的起点。
mt: Hong Kong Island is a metonym for the Hong Kong region and the focus of many tourists. The many buildings that make up the Hong Kong skyline are like a flashing bar graph, standing out in the reflection of Victoria Harbour. To best appreciate the beauty of Hong Kong, leave the island and go to the waterfront in Kowloon. Most of the city development on the island is concentrated on the reclaimed land on the north shore. This is where the British colonized, so if you want to find evidence of the colonial history of this territory, this is a good starting point.
ref: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus. The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour. To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite. The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore. This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.

src: 马镫悬挂在马鞍两侧，用来支撑骑手的双脚。 它们为骑手提供了更好的稳定性，但也有安全隐患，因为骑手的脚可能会卡住。 如果骑手从马上被甩下来，但有一只脚卡在马镫上，那么马在奔跑时可能会拖着他走。为了将这种风险降至最低，可以采取一些预防措施。 首先，大多数骑马人会穿带跟马靴，而且鞋底光滑及相当狭窄。 其次，一些马鞍——尤其是英式马鞍——配有安全扣，如果落马的骑手向后拉，马镫皮带就会从马鞍上掉下来。
mt: Stirrups are attached to the sides of the saddle and provide the rider with greater stability, but they also have a safety risk, as the rider's feet could get caught. If the rider is thrown from the horse but one foot is caught in the stirrup, the horse could drag him along as it runs. To minimize this risk, there are a few preventative measures that can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots, which are smooth and narrow at the bottom. Second, some saddles, especially English saddles, have safety straps that will come off the saddle if the rider pulls back after falling off.
ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

src: 食宿交换网络是一个让旅客和其目的地城市的本地居民连接的组织。 加入这样的组织，通常只需要填写一张在线表格；尽管有些组织提供或要求额外的验证。 随后会提供一份纸质版和/或在线版名单，将尚有空房的房东一一列出，有时会标明其他旅客的推荐和评价信息。 沙发冲浪成立于 2004 年 1 月。在那之前，计算机程序员凯西·芬顿 (Casey Fenton) 找到了飞往冰岛的廉价航班，但却没有住所。 他给当地大学的学生发送邮件后，提供免费住宿的邀请蜂拥而至。
mt: A homestay network is an organization that connects travelers with local residents in their destination city. To join such an organization, usually all that is required is filling out an online form; some organizations provide or require additional verification. A printed and/or online list is then provided, listing homeowners who have vacancies, sometimes with the recommendations and reviews of other travelers. CouchSurfing was founded in January 2004. Before that, computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but had no place to stay. He sent emails to students at the local university, and invitations to stay for free came pouring in.
ref: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit. Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification. A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers. Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay. He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.

src: 旅舍主要为年轻人提供服务，二十岁左右的年轻人便是其典型客户，但你也可以经常在那里遇到相对年长的人。 尽管很少有带着孩子的家庭，但一些旅舍会允许他们住单间。
mt: Hostels are primarily geared towards young people, with the typical customer being in their early twenties, but you can often find older people staying there as well.  While few families with children stay at hostels, some will allow them to stay in a single room.
ref: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too. Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.

src: 投掷回旋镖是很多游客都想学会的一项热门技能。 如果你想学掷回力镖，让它飞出去之后能飞回手中，请务必使用可以飞回的合适的回力镖。 实际上，澳大利亚市面上的大多数回旋镖都飞不回来。初学者最好不要尝试在大风中投掷回旋镖
mt: Throwing boomerangs is a popular skill many tourists want to learn. If you want to learn to throw a boomerang so it comes back to you, make sure you use a boomerang that can come back. Most boomerangs sold in Australia don't come back. Beginners should not try throwing boomerangs in windy conditions.
ref: Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists want to acquire. If you want to learn throwing a boomerang that comes back to your hand, make sure you have a suitable boomerang for returning. Most boomerangs available in Australia are in fact non-returning. It is best for beginners to not try throwing in windy

src: 印度尼西亚有 17,000 个岛屿，因此印尼菜只是一个统称，它涵盖了全国各种各样的地方菜系。 但如果没有更多修饰语，这个词往往指的是原产于主岛爪哇岛中部和东部地区的食物。 现在，群岛上到处都能吃到爪哇菜，其中有多款调味方法简单的菜品，而爪哇人喜欢的主要调味料有花生、辣椒、糖（尤其是爪哇椰子糖）和各种香辛料。
mt: Indonesia has 17,000 islands, so Indonesian cuisine is a catch-all term that covers the various regional cuisines of the country. But if no further qualification is given, this word usually refers to food from the central and eastern regions of the main island of Java. Now, the islands are dotted with Javanese food, including some simple dishes with a few flavorings, and the main flavorings that Javanese people like are peanuts, chilies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various spices.
ref: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation. But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java. Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.

src: 对于那些不熟悉医学术语的人来说，”传染性”和“触染性”这两个词的含义截然不同。 传染病是由包括病毒、细菌、真菌和其他寄生物在内的病原体引起的疾病。 传染病是指在感染者附近极易传播的一类疾病。 多国政府要求入境游客或离境居民接种一系列疾病疫苗。 这些要求通常取决于旅行者已经访问或打算访问的国家。
mt: For those unfamiliar with medical terminology, the terms "infectious" and "contagious" have very different meanings. An infectious disease is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacteria, fungus, or other microbe. A contagious disease is one that is easily spread among people. Many governments require travelers to have been vaccinated against a series of diseases. These requirements usually depend on the countries the traveler has visited or plans to visit.
ref: For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have distinct meanings. An infectious disease is one that is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus or other parasites. A contagious disease is a disease which is easily transmitted by being in the vicinity of an infected person. Many governments require visitors entering, or residents leaving, their countries to be vaccinated for a range of diseases. These requirements may often depend on what countries a traveller has visited or intends to visit.

src: 对于那些不熟悉医学术语的人来说，”传染性”和“触染性”这两个词的含义截然不同。 传染病是由包括病毒、细菌、真菌和其他寄生物在内的病原体引起的疾病。 传染病是指在感染者附近极易传播的一类疾病。 多国政府要求入境游客或离境居民接种一系列疾病疫苗。 这些要求通常取决于旅行者已经访问或打算访问的国家。
mt: For those unfamiliar with medical terminology, the terms "infectious" and "contagious" have very different meanings. An infectious disease is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacteria, fungus, or other microbe. A contagious disease is one that is easily spread among people. Many governments require travelers to have been vaccinated against a series of diseases. These requirements usually depend on the countries the traveler has visited or plans to visit.
ref: For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have distinct meanings. An infectious disease is one that is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus or other parasites. A contagious disease is a disease which is easily transmitted by being in the vicinity of an infected person. Many governments require visitors entering, or residents leaving, their countries to be vaccinated for a range of diseases. These requirements may often depend on what countries a traveller has visited or intends to visit.

src: 个人 VPN（虚拟专用网络）程序是规避政治审查和商业 IP 地理过滤的绝佳工具。 它们优于网页代理的原因如下：它们重新路由所有互联网流量，而不仅仅是超文本传送协议 (http) 内容。 它们通常会提供更高的带宽和更优质的服务。它们经过加密，更难被监视。
mt: Personal VPN (Virtual Private Network) programs are excellent tools for circumventing political censorship and commercial IP geographic filtering. They are superior to web proxies because they re-route all internet traffic, not just HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) content. They typically provide higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and more difficult to monitor.
ref: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. They are superior to web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all Internet traffic, not only http. They normally offer higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and thus harder to spy on.

They are superior to web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all Internet traffic, not only http. They normally offer higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and thus harder to spy on.

src: 因为呼叫是通过互联网路由的，因此你不必使用位于你居住地或旅行地点的通话公司。 是否在居住的社区获得本地号码，这点没有要求；你可以在阿拉斯加奇金的野外获得卫星互联网连接，然后选一个号码，显示你位于阳光明媚的亚利桑那州。 很多时候，你必须单独购买一个可以在全球使用的号码，这样才能接听来自公共交换电话网 (PSTN) 电话的呼叫。该号码的来源地对主叫方有很大影响。
mt: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you don't have to use a company based in your home or travel location. You can get a local number in your home community, or in the wilds of Alaska's Chugach National Forest, and display a number that shows you're in sunny Arizona. Many times you have to buy a number that can be used globally to receive calls from the public switched telephone network (PSTN). The location of the number has a big impact on the caller.
ref: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you do not need to use a phone company located where you live or where you travel. There is also no requirement that you obtain a local number from the community in which you live; you can obtain a satellite Internet connection in the wilds of Chicken, Alaska and select a number which claims you're in sunny Arizona. Often, you have to buy a global number separately that allows PSTN phones to call you. Where the number is from makes a difference for people calling you.

src: 意大利语的发音相对容易，因为大多数单词的发音与拼写完全相同 需要注意的主要字母是 c 和 g，因为它们的发音是根据以下元音变化的。 另外，需要确保对 r 和 rr 采取不同的发音： “caro“ 的意思是”亲爱的“，而 “carro” 的意思则是“双轮战车”。
mt: Italian pronunciation is relatively easy because most words are pronounced exactly as they are spelled. The main letters to be aware of are c and g, which are pronounced according to the following vowels. Also, make sure to differentiate between r and rr: “caro” means “dear,” while “carro” means “cart.”
ref: Pronunciation is relatively easy in Italian since most words are pronounced exactly how they are written The main letters to watch out for are c and g, since their pronunciation varies based on the following vowel. Also, make sure to pronounce r and rr differently: caro means dear, whereas carro means chariot.

src: 伊兹密尔是土耳其第三大城市，人口约 370 万，它是土耳其第二大港口，仅次于伊斯坦布尔，它也是一个繁忙的交通枢纽。 曾经是士麦那 (Smyrna) 古城，如今已成为一个现代化、发达且繁忙的商业中心，周围是巨大的海湾和群山。 在宽阔的林荫大道、玻璃外墙的建筑和现代化的购物中心之间，散布着传统的红瓦屋顶、18 世纪的市场以及古老的清真寺和教堂，不过这座城市比传统的土耳其更有地中海欧洲的氛围。
mt: Izmir is the third largest city in Turkey, with a population of about 3.7 million, it is the second largest port in Turkey, second only to Istanbul, and is also a busy transportation hub. It was once the ancient city of Smyrna, and is now a modern, developed and busy commercial center, surrounded by a vast bay and mountains. Between the wide avenues, glass-walled buildings and modern shopping centers, there are traditional red-tiled roofs, 18th-century markets and ancient mosques and churches, but this city has a more Mediterranean European atmosphere than traditional Turkey.
ref: İzmir is the third largest city in Turkey with a population of around 3.7 million, the second biggest port after Istanbul, and a very good transport hub. Once the ancient city of Smyrna, it is now a modern, developed, and busy commercial center, set around a huge bay and surrounded by mountains. The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey.

src: 赏樱，亦称“花见”（hanami），从 8 世纪开始就成为了日本习俗。 这一概念来自中国，梅花是中国人喜闻乐见的一种花卉。 在日本，最早的樱花派对是由天皇为他自己和皇室其他贵族成员在皇家御所举办的。
mt: Hanami, or "flower viewing," has been a Japanese tradition since the eighth century. The concept originated in China, where the plum blossom is a popular flower. In Japan, the earliest cherry blossom parties were held by the emperor for himself and other members of the imperial court at the royal palace.
ref: Cherry blossom viewing, known as hanami, has been a part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The concept came from China where plum blossoms were the flower of choice. In Japan, the first cherry blossom parties were hosted by the emperor only for himself and other members of the aristocracy around the Imperial Court.

In Japan, the first cherry blossom parties were hosted by the emperor only for himself and other members of the aristocracy around the Imperial Court.

src: 耶路撒冷是以色列的首都和最大城市，尽管大多数的其他国家/地区和联合国都不承认耶路撒冷是以色列的首都。 坐落于犹太山丘 （Judean Hills） 上的这座古城，引人入胜的历史长达几千年之久。 这座城市是三大一神宗教——犹太教、基督教和伊斯兰教的圣地，是一个真正的精神、宗教和文化中心。 耶路撒冷（尤其是老城的许多场所）的宗教意义使这座城成为以色列主要旅游目的地之一。 耶路撒冷不仅有许多历史、考古和文化遗址，还有充满活力、人头涌涌的购物中心、咖啡馆和餐馆。
mt: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, although most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. This ancient city, with its fascinating history spanning thousands of years, is located on the Judean Hills. Jerusalem is a holy city for the three major monotheistic religions – Judaism, Christianity and Islam – and is a true spiritual, religious and cultural center. Jerusalem's religious significance makes it one of Israel's main tourist destinations, especially in the Old City where many sites are located. Jerusalem is not only full of historical, archaeological and cultural sites, but also has lively, bustling shopping centers, cafes and restaurants.
ref: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital. The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years. The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center. Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel. Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.

src: 克鲁格国家公园 (KNP) 位于南非东北部，东部与莫桑比克接壤，北部与津巴布韦接壤，南部以鳄鱼河 (Crocodile River) 为边境。 公园占地 19500 平方公里，分为 14 个不同的生态区，为不同的野生动植物提供支持。 它是南非的主要景点之一，被认为是南非国家公园体系 (SANParks) 的主打景点。 与所有南非国家公园一样，该公园每天都收取养护费和门票费。 买一张万能卡（Wild Card）也有不少好处。带着这张卡，你可以进入南非的一些公园或全部的国家公园。
mt: Kruger National Park (KNP) is located in northeastern South Africa, bordering Mozambique to the east, Zimbabwe to the north, and the Crocodile River to the south. The park covers an area of 19,500 square kilometers and is divided into 14 different ecological zones, providing support for different wild animals and plants. It is one of the main attractions in South Africa and is considered the flagship of the South African National Park System (SANParks). Like all South African national parks, this park charges a maintenance fee and an entrance fee every day. There are also many benefits to buying a Wild Card. With this card, you can enter some or all of the national parks in South Africa.
ref: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River. The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife. It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks). As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park. It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.

src: 高耸于马丘比丘北端的这座陡峭的山峰，常常会成为许多遗址照片的背景。 从下面往上看有点吓人，而且是陡峭而艰难的上坡路，但大多数身体状况良好的人应该能在 45 分钟内完成。 小径的大部分路段都铺设了石阶；在较陡的部分还有钢缆作为支撑的扶手。 据说会让人喘不过气来，还有在陡峭的地方要小心谨慎，特别是天气潮湿时，情况有可能很快变得很危险。 必须穿过靠近顶部的一个很低、很狭窄的小洞。
mt: This steep peak towering over the northern end of Machu Picchu is often the background for many site photos. It looks intimidating from below and is a steep and difficult uphill path, but most people in good physical condition should be able to do it in 45 minutes. The path is mostly paved with stone steps; in the steeper parts there are steel cables as handrails. It is said to be breath-taking and you have to be careful in the steeper parts, especially when it is wet, the situation can quickly become dangerous. You have to go through a very low and narrow hole near the top.
ref: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins. It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes. Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail. That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly. There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.

src: 马略卡岛的菜肴和地中海相似地区的菜肴一样，主要以面包、蔬菜和肉类（尤其是猪肉）为基础，而且完全使用橄榄油。 Pa amb Oli 是一种在夏天尤为流行的简单晚餐：面包搭配橄榄油、番茄，手头上任何佐料都可加入，比如奶酪、金枪鱼等。
mt: The cuisine of Mallorca is similar to that of the Mediterranean, with bread, vegetables and meat (especially pork) as the basis, and olive oil used exclusively. Pa amb oli is a simple summer dinner that is popular: bread with olive oil, tomatoes, and any seasoning you have on hand, such as cheese or tuna.
ref: Majorcan cuisine, like that of similar zones in the Mediterranean, is based on bread, vegetables and meat (specially pork), and uses olive oil throughout. A simple popular dinner, especially during the summer, is the Pa amb Oli: Bread with olive oil, tomato, and any available condiments such as cheese, tunafish, etc.

src: Hangi 指的是烧窑美食。 坑洞通过用火烧过的石头加热，在某些地方则是利用地热使地面自然变热。 石头火锅经常用于烹饪传统的烤肉大餐。 罗托鲁瓦有几个地方提供地热窑烤 (hangi)，而在克赖斯特彻奇、惠灵顿和其他地方也可以品尝到其他做法的毛利窑烤。
mt: Hangi refers to pit-cooked food.  Pits are heated by burning rocks or in some places by natural geothermal heat.  Stone ovens are often used to cook traditional roast dinners.  Rotorua has several places offering geothermal hangi, while in Christchurch, Wellington and other places you can also try other methods of Maori hangi.
ref: A Hangi Meal is cooked in a hot pit in the ground. The pit is either heated with hot stones from a fire, or in some places geothermal heat makes areas of ground naturally hot. The hangi is often used to cook a traditional roast style dinner. Several places in Rotorua offer geothermal hangi, while other hangi can be sampled in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.

src: Hangi 指的是烧窑美食。 坑洞通过用火烧过的石头加热，在某些地方则是利用地热使地面自然变热。 石头火锅经常用于烹饪传统的烤肉大餐。 罗托鲁瓦有几个地方提供地热窑烤 (hangi)，而在克赖斯特彻奇、惠灵顿和其他地方也可以品尝到其他做法的毛利窑烤。
mt: Hangi refers to pit-cooked food.  Pits are heated by burning rocks or in some places by natural geothermal heat.  Stone ovens are often used to cook traditional roast dinners.  Rotorua has several places offering geothermal hangi, while in Christchurch, Wellington and other places you can also try other methods of Maori hangi.
ref: A Hangi Meal is cooked in a hot pit in the ground. The pit is either heated with hot stones from a fire, or in some places geothermal heat makes areas of ground naturally hot. The hangi is often used to cook a traditional roast style dinner. Several places in Rotorua offer geothermal hangi, while other hangi can be sampled in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.

src: 女性在参观修道院时必须穿裙子，裙子必须及膝，肩膀也要覆盖住。 大多数修道院都会为没有准备的女性提供裹身衣，但如果你自己带，尤其是颜色鲜艳的，门口的修道士会向你投来抿嘴一笑。 同理，男士也必须穿着长裤，遮住膝盖。 也可以从入口处的存衣柜借到，但衣服并不是每次有人穿过后都会洗，所以这些裙子穿起来可能会有点不舒服。全部都是均码哦!
mt: 1. Women must wear skirts when visiting the convent, and the skirt must be knee-length, and the shoulders must be covered. Most convents will provide a wrap for women who are not prepared, but if you bring your own, especially bright colors, the monks at the door will smile at you with a smile. Similarly, men must wear long pants, covering the knees. You can also borrow clothes from the storage cabinet at the entrance, but the clothes are not washed every time someone wears them, so these skirts may be a little uncomfortable to wear. All are standard sizes!
ref: While visiting the monasteries, women are required to wear skirts covering the knees and have their shoulders covered, too. Most of the monasteries do provide wraps for women who come unprepared, but if you bring your own, especially one with bright colors, you'll get a smile from the monk or nun at the entrance. Along the same line, men are required to wear trousers covering the knees. This too can be borrowed from the stock at the entrance but that clothing isn't washed after every user so you may not feel comfortable wearing these skirts. One size fits all for men!

src: 如果冬季去北极或南极地区旅游，你就能体验到极夜，即一段时间内太阳不会从地平线上升起。 这提供了一个可以看到北极光的绝佳机会，因为天空将或多或少连续一整天都是暗的。 这些地区人口稀少，一般不存在光污染的问题，你也能欣赏到璀璨星空。
mt: If you travel to the Arctic or Antarctic regions in winter, you can experience the polar night, a period of time during which the sun does not rise above the horizon. This provides an excellent opportunity to see the aurora, as the sky will be dark for most or all of the day. These regions are sparsely populated, so there is little light pollution, and you can enjoy a brilliant night sky.
ref: If you visit the Arctic or Antarctic areas in the winter you will experience the polar night, which means that the sun doesn't rise above the horizon. This offers a good opportunity to see the Aurora borealis, as the sky will be dark more or less around the clock. As the areas are sparsely populated, and light pollution therefore often not a problem, you will also be able to enjoy the stars.

src: 在手机信号覆盖不到的偏远地区，卫星电话可能是你的唯一选择。 一般来说，卫星电话不能取代移动电话，因为只有在卫星信号畅通的室外，才能进行通话。 该服务经常用于航运，包括游艇以及有远程数据和语音需求的探险。 你当地的电话服务提供商应该能够提供关于连接到这项服务的详细信息。
mt: In remote areas where cell phone coverage is not available, satellite phones may be your only option. Generally, satellite phones cannot replace mobile phones, as they can only be used outdoors where satellite signals are available. The service is often used in shipping, including yachts, and for expeditions that require remote data and voice communications. Your local phone service provider should be able to provide you with detailed information on connecting to this service.
ref: In remote locations, without cell phone coverage, a satellite phone may be your only option. A satellite phone is not generally a replacement for a mobile phone, as you have to be outdoors with clear line of sight to the satellite to make a phone call. The service is frequently used by shipping, including pleasure craft, as well as expeditions who have remote data and voice needs. Your local telephone service provider should be able to give more information about connecting to this service.

src: 摩尔多瓦的首都是基希讷乌。当地语言是罗马尼亚语，但俄语也被广泛使用。 摩尔多瓦是一个多民族共和国，饱受民族冲突之苦。 1994 年，这场冲突导致摩尔多瓦东部自诩为德涅斯特河沿岸共和国的成立。该共和国有自己的政府和货币，但没有得到任何联合国成员国的认可。 尽管政治谈判失败，但摩尔多瓦这两个地区的经济联系得以重建。 摩尔多瓦 (Moldova) 的主要宗教是东正教。
mt: The capital of Moldova is Chișinău. The local language is Romanian, but Russian is widely spoken. Moldova is a multiethnic republic that has suffered from ethnic conflict. In 1994, this conflict led to the establishment of the self-proclaimed Transnistria Republic in the east of Moldova. This republic has its own government and currency, but has not been recognized by any United Nations member state. Although political negotiations failed, economic links between the two regions of Moldova were rebuilt. The main religion of Moldova (Moldova) is Eastern Orthodoxy.
ref: The capital of Moldova is Chişinău. The local language is Romanian, but Russian is widely used. Moldova is a multi-ethnic republic that has suffered from ethnic conflict. In 1994, this conflict led to the creation of the self-proclaimed Transnistria Republic in eastern Moldova, which has its own government and currency but is not recognised by any UN member country. Economic links have been re-established between these two parts of Moldova despite the failure in political negotiations. The major religion in Moldova is Orthodox Christian.

src: 蒙得维的亚位于赤道以南，因此北半球冬天的时候，那里是夏天，反之亦然。 蒙得维的亚位于亚热带地区；在夏季月份，气温常常超过 30°C 。 冬天可能会比看上去显得更冷：温度很少低于零度，但当风和湿度结合在一起，会让人感觉比温度计显示的温度要冷。 这里没有特定的“雨季”和“旱季”：全年的降雨量大致相同。
mt: The city is located south of the equator, so its winter is the northern hemisphere's summer, and vice versa.  It is located in the tropics; in the summer months, temperatures often exceed 30°C.  Winter may be colder than it looks: temperatures rarely fall below zero, but when wind and humidity combine, it can feel colder than the thermometer indicates.  There is no distinct "rainy season" and "dry season": rainfall is roughly the same throughout the year.
ref: "Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa. Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common. The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says. There are no particular ""rainy"" and ""dry"" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year."

src: 擅自绘制的壁画或乱写乱涂被称为涂鸦。 尽管这绝不是现代才出现的现象，但大多数人很可能会将其与年轻人使用喷漆破坏公共和私有财产联系起来。 然而，如今已经有了成熟的涂鸦艺术家、涂鸦活动和“合法”涂鸦墙。在这种背景下创作的涂鸦绘画往往更类似于艺术品，而非难以辨认的标签。
mt: Graffiti, or unauthorized drawings and scribbles, is often associated with young people using spray paint to vandalize public and private property. However, there are now established graffiti artists, graffiti events, and "legal" graffiti walls in the background. In this context, graffiti art is often more like art than illegible tags.
ref: "Unwanted murals or scribble is known as graffiti. While it's far from a modern phenomenon, most people probably associate it with youth vandalizing public and private property using spray paint. However, nowadays there are established graffiti artists, graffiti events and ""legal"" walls. Graffiti paintings in this context often resemble artworks rather than illegible tags."

src: 在一些音乐节，绝大多数参加者选择在现场露营，而且大部分参加者认为这是音乐节体验极为重要的一部分。 如果想近距离观看演出，你得早点到，在靠近舞台的地方占好营地。 记住，虽然主舞台上的音乐可能已经结束，但节日的其他部分可能会一直演奏音乐到深夜。 有些音乐节会为带小孩的家庭设立特别的露营区。
mt: At some music festivals, most attendees choose to camp on-site, and most attendees consider this to be an important part of the festival experience. If you want to get close to the action, you'll need to get there early and stake out a spot near the stage. Remember, while the main stage's music may have ended, other parts of the festival may keep playing music until the wee hours. Some festivals will set up special camping areas for families with kids.
ref: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience. If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music. Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night. Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.

src: 鉴于许多普韦布洛人居住得非常偏远，你得前往阿尔伯克基或圣达菲才能享受到丰富的夜生活。 然而，上面列出的几乎所有赌场都供应饮料，其中一些赌场还提供知名的娱乐活动（主要是紧邻阿尔伯克基和圣达菲的大型赌场）。 注意：对来自其他州的游客而言，这里的小镇酒吧并不总是闲逛的好地方。 首先，新墨西哥州北部有严重的酒驾问题，并且小镇酒吧附近的司机酒驾的比例很高。
mt: Since many Pueblos live in remote areas, you'll have to go to Albuquerque or Santa Fe to enjoy a vibrant nightlife. However, all of the casinos listed above serve alcohol, and some casinos offer well-known entertainment (primarily the large casinos near Albuquerque and Santa Fe). Note: Bars in small towns are not always good places to walk around for visitors from other states. First, there is a serious drunk driving problem in northern New Mexico, and the rate of drunk driving near small town bars is high.
ref: Given how remote many of the pueblos are, you won't be able to find a significant amount of nightlife without traveling to Albuquerque or Santa Fe. However, nearly all of the casinos listed above serve drinks, and several of them bring in name-brand entertainment (primarily the large ones immediately surrounding Albuquerque and Santa Fe). Beware: small-town bars here are not always good places for the out-of-state visitor to hang out. For one thing, northern New Mexico has significant problems with drunk driving, and the concentration of intoxicated drivers is high close to small-town bars.

src: 当地主要的啤酒是“一号”啤酒。它的口感不复杂，但很好喝、很清爽。另一款本地啤酒叫做“曼塔 (Manta)”。 在这里可以买到很多法国葡萄酒，但新西兰和澳大利亚的葡萄酒可能更经得起长途运输。 当地的自来水完全可以达到安全饮用标准，但如果你还是担心，也可以很容易地买到瓶装水。 对澳大利亚人来说，“馥芮白”咖啡的概念还比较陌生。小杯黑咖啡是“浓缩咖啡”，卡布奇诺的奶油（不是泡沫）堆得很高，而茶是不搭配牛奶的。 热巧克力达到了比利时的标准。果汁价格昂贵，但品质很好。
mt: 1. The local beer is "Number One" beer. It's not complicated, but it's good and refreshing. Another local beer is called "Manta". You can buy a lot of French wines here, but New Zealand and Australian wines may be more durable for long-distance transportation. Local tap water is completely safe to drink, but if you are still worried, you can easily buy bottled water. For Australians, the concept of "Froebel" coffee is still unfamiliar. A small cup of black coffee is "espresso", the milk in cappuccino is piled up high, and tea is not served with milk. Hot chocolate has reached the standards of Belgium. Fruit juices are expensive, but the quality is good.
ref: "The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called ""Manta"". There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better. The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful. For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk. The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent."

A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk. The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent."

src: 瓜拉尼人 (Guaraní) 是居住在现东巴拉圭地区的最重要的土著群体，他们过着半游牧式的游猎生活，也会进行自给自足的农业活动。 查科 (Chaco) 地区是瓜伊库鲁 (Guaycuru) 和帕亚瓜 (Payagua) 等其他土著部落的家园，他们靠狩猎、采集和捕鱼为生。 16 世纪的巴拉圭曾被称为“印第安大省”，是西班牙征服者与当地土著群体的相遇后的产物。 西班牙人开始了长达三个世纪的殖民时期。 自从 1537 年亚松森（Asunción）建成以来，巴拉圭一直设法保留了这座城的许多本土特色和特性。
mt: The Guaraní are the most important indigenous group living in the present-day eastern Paraguay, who lived a semi-nomadic hunting and gathering lifestyle, and also practiced subsistence agriculture. The Chaco region is the home of other indigenous groups such as the Guaycuru and Payagua, who lived by hunting, gathering, and fishing. Paraguay was called the "Indian Province" after the encounter of the Spanish conquerors with the local indigenous groups. The Spanish began a three-century-long colonial period. Since the founding of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has been able to preserve many of the local features and characteristics of this city.
ref: "The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture. The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing. In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called ""The Giant Province of the Indies"", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups. The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries. Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity."

src: 巴黎人是出了名的以自我中心、粗鲁和傲慢。 虽然这通常只是一种不准确的刻板印象，但在巴黎生活的最佳方式仍然是尽量举止得当，表现得像一个有 “bien élevé”（教养良好）的人。这会让参加社会活动变得容易得多。 如果你表现出一点基本的礼貌，巴黎人粗鲁的表现很快就会消失无踪。
mt: Parisians are notorious for being self-centered, rude, and arrogant. While this is usually just an inaccurate stereotype, the best way to live in Paris is still to try to behave well and act like a "bien élevé" (well-bred) person. This will make social interactions much easier. If you show a little basic courtesy, Parisians' rude behavior will soon disappear.
ref: "Parisians have a reputation for being egocentric, rude and arrogant. While this is often only an inaccurate stereotype, the best way to get along in Paris still is to be on your best behavior, acting like someone who is ""bien élevé"" (well brought up). It will make getting about considerably easier. Parisians' abrupt exteriors will rapidly evaporate if you display some basic courtesies."

src: 开普敦城内和绕城的通勤火车上有 MetroRail 车厢，MetroRail 有两个等级：MetroPlus（也叫头等舱）和Metro（也叫三等舱）。 MetroPlus 更舒适，也没那么拥挤，但稍微贵了一点，即便如此还是比欧洲的普通地铁票便宜。 每列火车都有 MetroPlus 和 Metro 车厢；前者总是在火车靠近开普敦的那一端。
mt: Commuter trains in and around Cape Town have MetroRail cars, MetroRail has two classes: MetroPlus (also called first class) and Metro (also called third class). MetroPlus is more comfortable and less crowded, but a little more expensive, but still cheaper than a regular European subway ticket. Each train has MetroPlus and Metro cars; the former is always at the end of the train closest to Cape Town.
ref: MetroRail has two classes on commuter trains in and around Cape Town: MetroPlus (also called First Class) and Metro (called Third Class). MetroPlus is more comfortable and less crowded but slightly more expensive, though still cheaper than normal metro tickets in Europe. Every train has both MetroPlus and Metro coaches; the MetroPlus coaches are always on the end of the train nearest Cape Town.

Every train has both MetroPlus and Metro coaches; the MetroPlus coaches are always on the end of the train nearest Cape Town.

src: 旅行者可能会遇到在家乡不常见的有害动物。 害虫会破坏食物，引起刺激性反应，在更严重的情况下会引起过敏反应，传播毒液或传染病。 传染性疾病本身，或那些能通过暴力杀伤人类的危险动物，通常不属于害虫之列。
mt: Travelers may encounter unfamiliar harmful animals at their destination. Pests can destroy food, cause allergic reactions, and in more serious cases, cause anaphylactic shock, transmit venom or disease. Diseases themselves, or animals that can kill humans through violence, are not usually considered pests.
ref: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions. Pests can spoil food, cause irritation, or in a worse case cause allergic reactions, spread venom, or transmit infections. Infectious diseases themselves, or dangerous animals that can injure or kill people by force, do not usually qualify as pests.

src: 每个街头小店都摆满了一排令人眼花缭乱的预付费电话卡，这些电话卡既可以用于公用付费电话机，也可以用于普通电话机。 尽管大多数电话卡适合给任何地方打电话，但有些卡在拨打一些特定国家的电话时有特别优惠。 通常拨打一个电话号码即可获取这些服务，而大多数的电话都可免费拨打该串号码。
mt: Every street corner kiosk is full of a bewildering array of prepaid phone cards, which can be used in public pay phones as well as ordinary phones.  Although most phone cards are good for calling anywhere, some cards have special deals for calling certain countries.  Usually, dialing a single number will get you these services, and most of the numbers are toll-free.
ref: Every corner store is filled with a confusing array of pre-paid phone cards that can be used from pay phones or ordinary telephones. While most cards are good for calling anywhere, some specialise in providing favourable call rates to specific groups of countries. Access to these services is often through a toll-free telephone number that can be called from most phones without charge.

src: 普利特维茨湖国家公园森林茂密，主要树种有山毛榉、云杉和冷杉，并以高山和地中海植被混合为特色。 由于小气候、土壤和海拔高度的多样性，这里的植物群落种类非常丰富，并因此闻名于世。 该地区也是各类动物和鸟类的家园。 在那里可以看到欧洲棕熊、狼、鹰、猫头鹰、猞猁、野猫和松鸡等稀有动物以及许多更常见的物种
mt: The park's forests are dense, with species including Douglas fir, spruce, and oak, and are characterized by a mix of alpine and Mediterranean vegetation. The area's diversity of microclimates, soils, and elevation is reflected in the park's rich plant communities, which are famous worldwide. The area is also home to a variety of animals and birds. There you can see European brown bears, wolves, eagles, owls, lynx, wildcats, and grouse, as well as many more common species.
ref: The Plitvice Lakes national park is heavily forested, mainly with beech, spruce, and fir trees, and features a mixture of Alpine and Mediterranean vegetation. It has a notably wide variety of plant communities, due to its range of microclimates, differing soils and varying levels of altitude. The area is also home to an extremely wide variety of animal and bird species. Rare fauna such as the European brown bear, wolf, eagle, owl, lynx, wild cat and capercaillie can be found there, along with many more common species

src: 媒体公司照例撒谎以掩盖其目的，声称这是为了“防止盗版”。 事实上，区域码对非法复制毫无影响；一份逐位拷贝的磁盘副本在任何可以播放原盘的设备上都可以顺利播放。 实际上的目的是为了让这些公司更好地控制他们的市场；一切都是为了圈钱。
mt: As usual, media companies lie to cover their true purpose, claiming it is to "prevent piracy." In fact, region codes have no effect on illegal copying; a bit-for-bit copy of a disk can be played on any device that can play the original disc. The real purpose is to allow these companies to better control their markets; it's all about the money.
ref: "The media companies routinely lie about the purpose of this, claiming that it is to ""prevent piracy"". In fact, region codes have absolutely no effect on illegal copying; a bit-for-bit copy of a disk will play just fine on any device where the original will. The actual purpose is to give those companies more control over their markets; it's all about money spinning."

src: 在回到本国时通常不需要进行入境检查或者只是走走形式，但过海关可能会很麻烦。 确保知晓可以携带什么，不能携带什么，并申报任何超出法律允许的物件。
mt: When returning to your home country, you usually don't need to go through customs or just walk through, but going through customs can be a hassle. Make sure you know what you can and can't carry, and declare any items that exceed the legal limit.
ref: While immigration check is usually absent or a formality when you arrive in your homeland, customs control can be a hassle. Make sure you know what you can and cannot bring in and declare anything over the legal limits.

ref: While immigration check is usually absent or a formality when you arrive in your homeland, customs control can be a hassle. Make sure you know what you can and cannot bring in and declare anything over the legal limits.

src: 智利首选登山目的地科茶莫山谷 (Cochamó Valley) 被称为南美洲的优胜美地 (Yosemite)，这里有各式各样的花岗岩大石壁和峭壁。 从山峰望去有着令人惊叹的壮丽景色。 来自世界各地的登山者在其绵延不断可作为攀援墙的峭壁上不断开拓新路线。
mt: Chile's first choice for mountain climbing destination Cochamó Valley is called the Yosemite of South America, here are various kinds of granite big rocks and cliffs. From the peak, there are magnificent views. Climbers from around the world are constantly opening new routes on the cliffs that stretch endlessly and can be used as a climbing wall.
ref: Cochamó Valley - Chile's premier climbing destination, known as the Yosemite of South America, with a variety of granite big walls and crags. Summits include breath-taking views from peaks. Climbers from all parts of the world are continually establishing new routes amongst its endless potential of walls.

src: 如果你只想在南半球范围内坐飞机环游世界，航班和目的地的选择都十分有限，因为跨洋航线很少。 南半球没有一家航空联盟的航线能横跨全部三个大洋（天合联盟甚至没有跨洋航线）。 然而，星空联盟涵盖了全球各条航线，不过从智利的圣地亚哥到塔希提岛的东南太平洋航线除外，这是南美航空 (LATAM) 寰宇一家航空公司的航线。 如果你不想经过南太平洋和南美洲西海岸，除了这个航班外还有别的选择。（见下文）
mt: If you only want to fly around the world in the southern hemisphere, your flight and destination choices are limited, as there are few transoceanic routes. There are no airline alliances that cross all three oceans (the Star Alliance doesn't even have a transoceanic route). However, the Star Alliance covers all routes around the world, except for the route from Santiago, Chile to Tahiti in the South Pacific Ocean, which is a route of LATAM, a member of the global airline alliance. If you don't want to go through the South Pacific and the west coast of South America, there are other options besides this flight. (See below)
ref: If you want to fly around the world completely in the Southern Hemisphere, the choice of flights and destinations is limited due to the lack of transoceanic routes. No airline alliance covers all three ocean crossings in the Southern Hemisphere (and SkyTeam covers none of the crossings). However, Star Alliance covers everything except the eastern South Pacific from Santiago de Chile to Tahiti, which is a LATAM Oneworld flight. This flight is not the only option if you want to skip the South Pacific and the west coast of South America. (see below)

src: 全球有近 200 个跑步旅游组织，大多独立运营。 全球跑步之旅 (Global Running Tours) 的接替者 Go Running Tours 把四大洲数十个观光跑运营商连接起来。 这个组织起源于巴塞罗那的“巴塞罗那跑步之旅”（Running Tours Barcelona ）组织和哥本哈根的“哥本哈根跑步”（Running Copenhagen）组织，很快布拉格的“布拉格跑步之旅”（ Running Tours Prague）及其他地区的组织也加入其中。
mt: There are nearly 200 running tour operators around the world, most of them independently operated. Go Running Tours, which succeeded Global Running Tours, connects dozens of sightseeing runs on four continents. The organization originated from the Running Tours Barcelona organization in Barcelona and the Running Copenhagen organization in Copenhagen, and soon the Running Tours Prague organization in Prague and other organizations joined.
ref: Internationally, there are nearly 200 running tour organizations. Most of them operate independently. The Global Running Tours successor, Go Running Tours networks dozens of sightrunning providers on four continents. With roots in Barcelona's Running Tours Barcelona and Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, it was quickly joined by Running Tours Prague based in Prague and others.

src: 游猎活动也许是非洲最吸引人的旅游活动，也是许多游客行程中的亮点。 “游猎 (safari)”一词，在常见的用法中是指通过陆路旅行去观赏令人惊叹的非洲野生动物，尤其是在热带草原上。 一些动物（例如大象和长颈鹿）往往喜欢挨近汽车，而标准的设备可以让人更好地欣赏。 狮子、猎豹和花豹有时很怕人，用双筒望远镜你能看得更清楚。 徒步旅行（ 也叫”丛林漫步”、“远足旅行”或“远足”）主要是徒步行走，通常耗时几个小时或持续数日。
mt: Safari is perhaps the most attractive tourist activity in Africa and a highlight of many itineraries. In common usage, the word “safari” refers to overland travel to view awe-inspiring African wildlife, especially on the tropical savannah. Some animals (such as elephants and giraffes) often like to get close to cars, and standard equipment allows you to see better. Lions, cheetahs and leopards sometimes fear people, and binoculars allow you to see more clearly. Hiking (also called “jungle walks,” “trekking” or “trekking”) is mainly walking on foot, usually for several hours or over several days.
ref: "Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors. The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna. Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing. Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars. A walking safari (also called a ""bush walk"", ""hiking safari"", or going ""footing"") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days."

src: 游猎活动也许是非洲最吸引人的旅游活动，也是许多游客行程中的亮点。 “游猎 (safari)”一词，在常见的用法中是指通过陆路旅行去观赏令人惊叹的非洲野生动物，尤其是在热带草原上。 一些动物（例如大象和长颈鹿）往往喜欢挨近汽车，而标准的设备可以让人更好地欣赏。 狮子、猎豹和花豹有时很怕人，用双筒望远镜你能看得更清楚。 徒步旅行（ 也叫”丛林漫步”、“远足旅行”或“远足”）主要是徒步行走，通常耗时几个小时或持续数日。
mt: Safari is perhaps the most attractive tourist activity in Africa and a highlight of many itineraries. In common usage, the word “safari” refers to overland travel to view awe-inspiring African wildlife, especially on the tropical savannah. Some animals (such as elephants and giraffes) often like to get close to cars, and standard equipment allows you to see better. Lions, cheetahs and leopards sometimes fear people, and binoculars allow you to see more clearly. Hiking (also called “jungle walks,” “trekking” or “trekking”) is mainly walking on foot, usually for several hours or over several days.
ref: "Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors. The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna. Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing. Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars. A walking safari (also called a ""bush walk"", ""hiking safari"", or going ""footing"") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days."

src: 旅游对人数较多的旅行团来说比较便宜。如果你独自一人或只有一个朋友同行，不妨试着认识其他人，组建 4 到 6 人的旅行团，这样可以获得更优惠的人均价格。 不过，也有一点要担心的地方，因为游客经常被运过来运过去以把汽车坐满。 这实际上更像是一种骗人的方式，让人们以为他们必须支付更多的钱。
mt: For large groups, travel is cheaper. If you're traveling alone or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six people to get a better per-person price. But there is one thing to be worried about: tourists are often brought in and out to fill the car. This is actually a deceptive way to make people think they have to pay more.
ref: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate. However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars. It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.

src: 旧金山的经济与自身是世界级旅游胜地这一点有关，但旧金山的经济却是多元化的。 就业最多的部门包括专业服务业、政府、金融、贸易和旅游业。 它经常出现在音乐、电影、文学和流行文化中，使得这座城市及其地标闻名于世。 旧金山开发了一个规模庞大的旅游基础设施，内设多家酒店、餐厅和一流的会议场所。 旧金山也是在美国品尝韩国菜、泰国菜、印度菜和日本菜等其他亚洲菜的好去处。
mt: 1. San Francisco's economy is closely tied to its status as a world-class tourist destination, but its economy is also diversified. The largest employers are in professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism. It is often featured in music, film, literature, and popular culture, making the city and its landmarks known worldwide. San Francisco developed a large and extensive tourist infrastructure, including many hotels, restaurants, and first-class meeting facilities. San Francisco is also a good place to taste Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese cuisine and other Asian cuisines in the United States.
ref: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified. The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism. Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world. San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities. San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.

src: 提前预订可以让旅行者安心，知道到达目的地后就有地方过夜。 虽然旅行社可能会帮你预订露营 等其他形式的住宿，但他们通常会与特定的酒店合作。 旅行社通常会提供包括早餐、机场往返接送的套餐，有的甚至会提供航班和酒店住宿套餐。 如果你需要时间考虑价格是否合适，或者去往目的地需要获取其他证件（如签证），他们可以为你保留预订。 如果需要进行任何修改或有任何要求，应该首先通过旅行代理商进行办理，而不是直接与酒店接洽。
mt: Booking in advance can give travelers peace of mind, knowing that they have a place to stay when they arrive at their destination. While travel agents may help you book camping and other forms of accommodation, they usually work with specific hotels. Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, airport transfers, and sometimes even flight and hotel stay packages. If you need time to consider the price or to obtain other documents (such as visas) to go to your destination, they can keep your reservation. If you need to make any changes or have any requests, you should first go through the travel agent rather than directly contacting the hotel.
ref: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination. Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent. Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages. They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa). Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.

src: 实时文本翻译应用：能够自动将整段文本从一种语言转换成另一种语言的应用程序。 某些此类应用程序甚至让用户把智能手机对着现实世界中的标志或其他物体，就能翻译上面的外语文字。 翻译引擎有了显著的改进，现在经常提供或多或少正确的翻译（而更多情况是很少有胡言乱语），但需要注意的是，他们仍然可能会完全翻错。 一个最杰出的此类应用是谷歌翻译。在下载所需语言数据后，它可以进行离线翻译。
mt: Real-time text translation apps: Apps that can automatically translate entire paragraphs of text from one language to another. Some of these apps even let users translate foreign words on real-world signs and other objects by pointing their smartphones at them. Translation engines have improved significantly, and often provide at least somewhat correct translations (and more often than not, very little gibberish), but it's important to note that they can still get it completely wrong. One of the best of these apps is Google Translate, which can perform offline translations after downloading language data.
ref: Real-time text translator apps – applications that are capable of automatically translating whole segments of text from one language into another. Some of the applications in this category can even translate texts in foreign languages on signs or other objects in the real world when the user points the smartphone towards those objects. The translation engines have improved dramatically, and now often give more or less correct translations (and more seldom gibberish), but some care is due, as they still may have gotten it all wrong. One of the most prominent apps in this category is Google Translate, which allows offline translation after downloading the desired language data.

src: 雪崩并不是异常现象；陡坡上所能容纳的雪量有限，多余的雪就会以雪崩的形式坠落。 问题是雪有很强的粘性。因此需要一些触发因素才能降雪，而有一点雪落下来也可能触发其他的雪下降。 有时起初的触发原因是太阳让雪变暖，有时是因为降雪多了些，有时是因为其他自然事件，但更常见的原因往往是人为因素。
mt: Avalanches are not uncommon; the amount of snow that can be held on a steep slope is limited, and excess snow will fall as an avalanche. The problem is that snow has a strong adhesive property. Therefore, some triggering factor is needed to initiate the snowfall, and once a little snow has fallen, it may trigger other snow to fall. Sometimes the initial triggering cause is the sun warming the snow, sometimes it is because the snowfall has increased, sometimes it is because of other natural events, but more often the cause is human.
ref: Avalanches are not an abnormality; steep slopes can hold only so much slow, and the excess volumes will come down as avalanches. The problem is that snow is sticky, so it needs some triggering to come down, and some snow coming down can be the triggering event for the rest. Sometimes the original trigging event is the sun warming the snow, sometimes some more snowfall, sometimes other natural events, often a human.

src: 咖喱饭菜是一道以香草和香料为主的菜肴，并配以肉类或蔬菜。 咖喱饭菜既可以是“干”的，也可以是“湿”的，干湿情况取决于水量多少。 在印度北部和巴基斯坦的内陆地区，咖喱中常常使用酸奶；而在印度南部和次大陆其他一些沿海地区，则常常使用椰奶。
mt: Curry is a dish in which the main ingredients are spices and herbs, often with meat or vegetables. It can be "dry" or "wet", depending on how much water is used. In the northern part of India and Pakistan, yogurt is often used in curries; while in the southern part of India and other parts of the subcontinent, coconut milk is often used.
ref: "A curry is a dish based on herbs and spices, together with either meat or vegetables. A curry can be either ""dry"" or ""wet"" depending on the amount of liquid. In inland regions of Northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is commonly used in curries; in Southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is commonly used."

src: 南极穿越公路 (South Pole Traverse)（或高速公路）始于罗斯海的麦克默多站 (McMurdo Station)，直通南极点，全长 1600 公里。 雪被压实，缝隙也被填满，并用旗帜做了标记。只有专门的拖拉机以及拖着装有燃料和补给的雪橇才能通行。 车子并不是很灵活，所以必须绕着横贯南极山脉，拐一个长长的的大弯才能来到高原。
mt: The South Pole Traverse (or Highway) begins at McMurdo Station on the Ross Sea and runs to the South Pole, a distance of 1,600 kilometers. The snow is packed down and the seams are filled in and marked with flags. Only specially equipped tractors and sleds carrying fuel and supplies can travel on it. The vehicles are not very maneuverable, so they must go around the transverse Antarctic mountain range, making a long big bend to get to the plateau.
ref: The South Pole Traverse (or Highway) is a 1600 km trail from McMurdo Station on the Ross Sea to the Pole. It's compacted snow with crevasses filled in and marked by flags. It can only be traveled by specialized tractors, hauling sleds with fuel and supplies. These aren't very nimble so the trail has to take a long swerve around the Transantarctic Mountains to come onto the plateau.

src: 南部非洲非常适合开车旅行，游客既可以欣赏该地区的所有美景，又可以到达常规旅游路线之外的地方。 只要细心规划，普通汽车就能做到，但强烈建议使用四驱汽车，而且许多地方只有大轴距四驱汽车才能通过。 规划期间，请记住，虽然南部非洲处于稳定状态，但并非所有邻国亦然。 签证要求和费用因国家/地区而异，并会受到你的国籍的影响。 每个国家/地区都立有专门法律，对务必放在车内的紧急物品进行了规定。
mt: South Africa is very car-friendly, allowing tourists to see all the sights and get to places off the beaten track. A normal car can do the job if you plan carefully, but a four-wheel drive is strongly recommended, and many places can only be done in a big four-wheel drive. When planning, remember that while South Africa is stable, not all its neighbours are. Visa requirements and fees vary by country and are affected by your nationality. Each country has its own laws regarding what must be kept in the car.
ref: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes. This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4. Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are. Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from. Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.

src: 为他人携带物品——千万不要让行李离开你的视线，尤其是在出入境时。 你可能会发现自己被人利用，在不知情的情况下成了一个运毒者，这会让你陷入很大的麻烦。 这包括排队等候，因为随时都可能在没有事先通知的情况下使用缉毒犬。 有些国家/地区甚至对初犯也会判以极其严厉的处罚；处罚可能包括 10 年以上的监禁或死刑。 无人看管的袋子不仅是窃贼的目标，还会被当成炸弹威胁，引起当局的警惕和关注。
mt: Carry your own belongings — never let your luggage out of your sight, especially when entering or leaving the country. You may find yourself being used as a drug mule without your knowledge, which will land you in a lot of trouble. This includes waiting in line, as sniffer dogs can be used at any time without prior notice. Some countries/regions even impose extremely harsh punishments for first-time offenders; these can include more than 10 years in prison or the death penalty. Unattended bags are not only targets for thieves, but will also be treated as bomb threats, causing authorities to be on alert and concerned.
ref: Carrying for others - Never let your bags out of your sight, especially when you are crossing international borders. You could find yourself being used as a drug carrier without your knowledge, which will land you in a great deal of trouble. This includes waiting in line, as drug-sniffing dogs could be used at any time without notice. Some countries have exceedingly draconian punishments even for first time offenses; these can include prison sentences of over 10 years or death. Unattended bags are a target for theft and can also attract attention from authorities wary of bomb threats.

src: 为他人携带物品——千万不要让行李离开你的视线，尤其是在出入境时。 你可能会发现自己被人利用，在不知情的情况下成了一个运毒者，这会让你陷入很大的麻烦。 这包括排队等候，因为随时都可能在没有事先通知的情况下使用缉毒犬。 有些国家/地区甚至对初犯也会判以极其严厉的处罚；处罚可能包括 10 年以上的监禁或死刑。 无人看管的袋子不仅是窃贼的目标，还会被当成炸弹威胁，引起当局的警惕和关注。
mt: Carry your own belongings — never let your luggage out of your sight, especially when entering or leaving the country. You may find yourself being used as a drug mule without your knowledge, which will land you in a lot of trouble. This includes waiting in line, as sniffer dogs can be used at any time without prior notice. Some countries/regions even impose extremely harsh punishments for first-time offenders; these can include more than 10 years in prison or the death penalty. Unattended bags are not only targets for thieves, but will also be treated as bomb threats, causing authorities to be on alert and concerned.
ref: Carrying for others - Never let your bags out of your sight, especially when you are crossing international borders. You could find yourself being used as a drug carrier without your knowledge, which will land you in a great deal of trouble. This includes waiting in line, as drug-sniffing dogs could be used at any time without notice. Some countries have exceedingly draconian punishments even for first time offenses; these can include prison sentences of over 10 years or death. Unattended bags are a target for theft and can also attract attention from authorities wary of bomb threats.

src: 清晨在家享受香浓咖啡，夜晚则泡上令人放松的甘菊茶。 宅在家里度假，手头上时间多了，可以稍微多花点时间泡一杯特别的饮品，犒劳犒劳自己。 如果你想更新奇一点，可以利用这个机会榨些果汁或制作混合奶昔： 也许你会发现一种在回归到规律的日常生活时，可以在早餐时制作的简单饮料。 如果你生活的城市有多种饮酒文化，那就去那些你不常去的街区的酒吧或酒馆。
mt: Enjoy a rich cup of coffee in the morning and a soothing chamomile tea at night. Staying at home for a vacation, you have more time on your hands, so you can take a little extra time to brew a special drink to reward yourself. If you want to be a little more unique, you can use this opportunity to squeeze some juice or make a mixed smoothie: You may find a simple drink that you can make for breakfast when you return to your regular life. If you live in a city with a variety of drinking cultures, go to those neighborhoods you don't usually go to bars or pubs.
ref: Fill your home with a rich coffee in the morning and some relaxing chamomile tea at night. When you're on a staycation, you have the time to treat yourself and take a few extra minutes to brew up something special. If you're feeling more adventurous, take the opportunity to juice or blend up some smoothies: maybe you'll discover a simple beverage that you can make for breakfast when you're back to your daily routine. If you live in a city with a varied drinking culture, go to bars or pubs in neighborhoods you don't frequent.

src: 在哈尔达斯维克村 (Haldarsvík) 可以欣赏附近依斯特洛伊岛 (Eysturoy) 的美景。村中有一个与众不同的八角形教堂。 教堂墓地里，一些坟墓上方摆着有趣的大理石鸽子雕塑。 在这个迷人的村庄漫步半小时是值得的。
mt: In Haldarsvík, you can enjoy the view of nearby Eysturoy island. The village has a distinctive octagonal church. In the churchyard, some graves have interesting granite dove sculptures. A half-hour walk through this charming village is worthwhile.
ref: The village of Haldarsvík offer views of the nearby island Eysturoy and has an unusual octagonal church. In the churchyard, there are interesting marble sculptures of doves over some tombs. It's worth half an hour to stroll about the intriguing village.

src: 尽管短期访问某些国家时，旅游或商务出行并不需要签证，但留学生去那里的话，所待的时间通常需比休闲的游客要长。 通常来说，较长时间停留在外国需要提前获取签证。 与普通旅游签证或商务签证相比，学生签证通常有不同的要求和申请程序。 在大多数国家，你需要一份你希望就读的学校的录取通知书，以及证明你有至少第一年课程所需资金的文件。 咨询学校及你希望留学的国家的移民局，以了解详细要求。
mt: While short-term visits to some countries may not require a visa for tourism or business travel, students going there will usually stay longer. In general, longer stays in a foreign country require obtaining a visa in advance. Student visas typically have different requirements and application procedures than ordinary tourist or business visas. In most countries, you will need a letter of acceptance from the school you wish to attend, as well as documents proving that you have at least the funds needed for the first year of study. Consult the school and the immigration office of the country you wish to study in for detailed requirements.
ref: While you may not need a visa for short visits to certain countries as a tourist or for business, going there as an international student generally requires a longer stay than going there just as a casual tourist. In general, staying in any foreign country for an extended period of time will require you to obtain a visa in advance. Student visas generally have different requirements and application procedures from normal tourist or business visas. For most countries, you will need an offer letter from the institution you wish to study at, and also evidence of funds to support yourself for at least the first year of your course. Check with the institution, as well as the immigration department for the country you wish to study in for detailed requirements.

src: 尤其在夏天，如果你决定徒步穿越雨林，就需要小心蚊子。 如果您正在开车穿越亚热带雨林，在您进入车内时车门敞开的几秒钟时间里，也足以让蚊子与您一起钻进车里。
mt: Especially in the summer, if you decide to hike through the rainforest, you need to be careful of mosquitoes. If you are driving through the tropical rainforest, the few seconds that the car door is open when you get in the car is enough time for mosquitoes to get in with you.
ref: In summer, especially, you'll need to watch out for mosquitoes if you decide to hike through the rainforest. Even if you're driving through the subtropical rainforest, a few seconds with the doors open while you get inside the vehicle is enough time for mosquitoes to get in the vehicle with you.

src: 尤其在夏天，如果你决定徒步穿越雨林，就需要小心蚊子。 如果您正在开车穿越亚热带雨林，在您进入车内时车门敞开的几秒钟时间里，也足以让蚊子与您一起钻进车里。
mt: Especially in the summer, if you decide to hike through the rainforest, you need to be careful of mosquitoes. If you are driving through the tropical rainforest, the few seconds that the car door is open when you get in the car is enough time for mosquitoes to get in with you.
ref: In summer, especially, you'll need to watch out for mosquitoes if you decide to hike through the rainforest. Even if you're driving through the subtropical rainforest, a few seconds with the doors open while you get inside the vehicle is enough time for mosquitoes to get in the vehicle with you.

src: 孙德本尔斯 (Sundarbans) 是世界上最大的滨海红树林带，林带长 80 公里（50 英里），从海岸一直延伸至孟加拉国和印度内陆。 孙德尔本斯 (Sundarbans) 已经被联合国教科文组织宣布为世界遗产。印度境内的这部分森林被称为孙德尔本斯国家公园。 不过，这些森林不仅仅是红树林沼泽，里面还有一些巨大丛林的遗迹，这些丛林曾经长满了恒河平原。 孙德本尔斯的面积为 3850 平方公里，其中约三分之一为水域/沼泽区。 自 1966 年以来，孙德尔本斯一直是野生动物保护区。据估计，目前该区生活着 400 只皇家孟加拉虎和大约 3 万只梅花鹿。
mt: Sundarbans is the largest mangrove forest in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) inland from the coast of Bangladesh and India. The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Indian part of the forest is called Sundarbans National Park. However, these forests are not just mangrove swamps, there are also some giant forest remnants that once covered the Ganges Plain. The Sundarbans covers an area of 3,850 square km, of which about one-third is water and swamp. Since 1966, the Sundarbans has been a wildlife sanctuary. It is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal Tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer living in the area.
ref: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast. The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park. The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain. The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas. Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.
